commentary.comment: The first half of this match is about to start.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) gets on the end of a cross but produces a tame shot from the edge of the area which goes well wide of the right post.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) manages to rise above the opponent's defenders to meet the well-taken corner kick with his head. His effort goes into the top left corner. What a finish!
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) fires the ball in from a mid-range free kick, but it blazes over the bar.
Johan Djourou just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Michael Ian Mancienne (Hamburger) replaces him.

Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) meets a pass on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the middle of the goal. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Wolfgang Hesl pulls off an easy save.
Ilir Azemi (Greuther Furth) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post.
The end of the first half.
Knut Kircher blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt to the left side of the target fails to beat Wolfgang Hesl, who makes a sensational save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Hamburger SV.
Stephan Furstner (Greuther Furth) collects a killer pass and fires a low shot into the middle of the net, giving the goalkeeper no chance.

Zoltan Stieber (Greuther Furth) meets a pass on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the bottom right corner. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Jaroslav Drobny pulls off an easy save.
Here comes a substitution. Tolgay Arslan is given a rest as he is replaced by Tomas Rincon (Hamburger).
Nikola Djurdjic will be replaced by Niclas Fullkrug (Greuther Furth).
Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) rises high to head a nice lofted cross towards the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, his close-range effort lacks pace and Wolfgang Hesl makes a comfortable save.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Rafael van der Vaart as he is replaced by Robert Tesche (Hamburger).
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Goran Sukalo (Greuther Furth) replacing Tim Sparv (Greuther Furth).

Niclas Fullkrug (Greuther Furth) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the right post. His effort, however, is blocked by Jaroslav Drobny, who pulls off a stunning save!
Ilir Azemi (Greuther Furth) attempts to find some of his teammates with a dangerous pass from the edge of the box. The opponent's defence intercepts the effort and clears the ball to safety.
The substitution is prepared. Ognjen Mudrinski (Greuther Furth) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Daniel Brosinski.

Niclas Fullkrug (Greuther Furth) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt under the bar fails to beat Jaroslav Drobny, who makes a sensational save.

Benedikt Rocker (Greuther Furth) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Jaroslav Drobny shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Tim Sparv (Greuther Furth) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.

Ilir Azemi (Greuther Furth) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but Jaroslav Drobny makes a comfortable save to stop his effort. The ball is out of play. Greuther Furth will have a chance to score from a corner.

Jaroslav Drobny was forced into action to thwart Ilir Azemi (Greuther Furth). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Felix Zwayer starts the second half.

Ilir Azemi (Greuther Furth) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and rose high to reach a fine corner kick. He fails to direct the ball past the goalkeeper as it flies narrowly over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.
The substitution is prepared. Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Robert Tesche.
Wolfgang Hesl makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the left-hand post by Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) after a cross from the side.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Niko Giesselmann (Greuther Furth) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The substitution has been made. Tom Weilandt (Greuther Furth) has replaced Nikola Djurdjic.
Ilir Azemi will be replaced by Niclas Fullkrug (Greuther Furth).
It is time for a substitution. Florian Trinks (Greuther Furth) is on for Zoltan Stieber.
The manager makes a subsitution with Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) coming on for Tomas Rincon.
The match has just finished.
Daniel Siebert checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.

Kevin Trapp pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Halil Altintop (Augsburg) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the bottom left corner, but was stopped by the goalkeeper.

It's a goal! Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes it 0:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Sebastian Jung and planted his close-range header into the bottom left corner. Marwin Hitz was helpless.

Andre Hahn (Augsburg) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the roof of the net. Kevin Trapp is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. It will be a corner kick for Augsburg.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header straight into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.
Today's referee Daniel Siebert rightly decides to book Pirmin Schwegler (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his harsh tackle.
Daniel Siebert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Daniel Siebert blows his whistle to start the second half.
The manager has decided to substitute Sascha Molders (Augsburg) and he has been replaced by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).

CLOSE! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
It will be a substitution. Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Tobias Werner walks off.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the left post!
Martin Lanig will be replaced by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Kevin Vogt will be replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Substitution. Stefano Celozzi (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Stefan Aigner walks off.

Matthias Ostrzolek sends a superb cross into the box. Andre Hahn (Augsburg) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Kevin Trapp beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:1.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Knut Kircher didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Aaron Hunt is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom left corner to make the score 0:1.
Knut Kircher shows a yellow card to Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul. Werder Bremen get a free kick.

It's a goal! Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Emre Can and planted his close-range header into the top left corner. Raphael Wolf was helpless.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Lars Bender limps off the pitch to be replaced by Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen).
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Knut Kircher has ended it.
The whistle blows and Knut Kircher starts the second half.
What a great touch by Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to a rebound inside the goalmouth, but his header hits the bar and spins away!
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the bottom left corner, and thus alter the score to 1:1.
Cedric Makiadi just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) replaces him.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Julian Brandt walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sidney Sam (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) replaces Franco Di Santo.
A substitution has been made. Philipp Bargfrede goes off and Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) comes on.

Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) got in a good shooting position on the edge of the box and pulled the trigger. The ball flew towards the top right corner, but Raphael Wolf punched it onto the post. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Bayer Leverkusen.
Substitution. Eren Derdiyok leaves the pitch and is replaced by Philipp Wollscheid (Bayer Leverkusen).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Referee Bastian Dankert blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Arthur Boka (VfB Stuttgart) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
What was Toni Kroos (Bayern Munich) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

What a wasted opportunity by Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich)! He creates himself some space inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the top right corner, but Sven Ulreich makes an astonishing save to thwart him. Bayern Munich will take a corner kick.
Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him.
Bastian Schweinsteiger is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Arthur Boka cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Bastian Dankert blows his whistle to start the second half.

Sven Ulreich makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the bottom left corner.
It's time for a substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) comes on in place of Mario Mandzukic.
Here's the change. Vedad Ibisevic leaves the pitch and Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Dante (Bayern Munich) for his blatant foul.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
A substitution has been made. Alexandru Maxim goes off and Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Goal! Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the right post. It's 1:0.
Bastian Dankert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Referee Peter Gagelmann blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went low towards the middle of the target, but Ron-Robert Zieler was alert and the score remained the same.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.
Today's referee Peter Gagelmann rightly decides to book Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) for his harsh tackle. Hannover are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) shoots from the free kick just outside the box, hitting the top right corner. Football supporters are always pleased to see such a fabulous goal.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Peter Gagelmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Lars Stindl (Hannover) leaps highest around the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick and produces a promising goal-bound header towards the right post, but Alexander Schwolow pulls off a fine save to deny him. Hannover have a corner.
Goal! Vladimir Darida puts a cross into the box and finds Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:1.
The goalkeeper pulls off a great save to deny Didier Ya Konan (Hannover), whose effort would probably have ended inside the bottom left corner of the net. Hannover get a corner.
Substitution. Didier Ya Konan makes way for Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover).
Substitution. Pavel Krmas did his best and is replaced by Immanuel Hohn (Freiburg).
Today's match ends for Sebastien Freis who will be replaced by Philipp Zulechner (Freiburg).
Goal! Leonardo Bittencourt slips it to Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom left corner with a great effort. The score is 2:1.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Peter Gagelmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the left side of the goal, but Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. It will be a corner kick for Freiburg.

Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Alexander Schwolow. The ball is out of play. Hannover will have a chance to score from a corner.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Julian Schuster walks off the pitch to be replaced by Gelson Fernandes (Freiburg).
Karim Guede (Freiburg) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Edgar Prib (Hannover) comes onto the pitch for Leonardo Bittencourt.
Goal! Philipp Zulechner (Freiburg) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Vladimir Darida. The score is 2:2.

Goal! Artjoms Rudnevs produces a great pass that finds Edgar Prib (Hannover) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot past the goalkeeper and into the back of the net. 1:1.

Alexander Schwolow hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) shoots from the edge of the box towards the top left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Hannover will take a corner kick.
The substitution is prepared. Andre Hoffmann (Hannover) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Szabolcs Huszti.
That's it for today, Peter Gagelmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) meets a cross and produces a header towards the top left corner, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) will take his place on the pitch.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund). Mats Hummels plays a fantastic through ball and finds Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
CHANCE! Marco Reus (Dortmund) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a shot towards Thomas Kraft, who produces an excellent reflex save.
An amazing individual effort from Milos Jojic (Dortmund) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the left side of the goal and makes it 0:2. Thomas Kraft was helpless.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Tobias Stieler starts the second half.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Oliver Kirch (Dortmund) replacing Nuri Sahin (Dortmund).
Substitution. Sokratis (Dortmund) has come on for Mats Hummels.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Sebastian Langkamp cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Substitution. Levan Kobiashvili is replaced by Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin).

Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin) sends a direct shot in from a dangerously positioned free kick. The ball sails to the top left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a quick save to deny him. Now Hertha Berlin have a corner.

What a great chance for Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header towards the top left corner, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Hertha Berlin.
Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Marco Reus is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund).
Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) scores from a free kick after smashing the ball over the defensive wall and into the top left corner of the goal!

Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Thomas Kraft leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Goal! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 0:4.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Peter Sippel has issued a yellow card to Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim).
A yellow card for a tackle by Karim Bellarabi (Braunschweig). Peter Sippel doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Andreas Beck sends a superb cross into the box. Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving Daniel Davari beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Today's referee Peter Sippel rightly decides to book Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Peter Sippel starts the second half.
Here's the change. Torsten Oehrl leaves the pitch and Damir Vrancic (Braunschweig) comes on as a substitute.
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) fires the ball towards the right side of the goal from close-range, but his shot is blocked by one of the defenders.
Amazing piece of skill! Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) picks up a cross on the edge of the 18-yard box and hammers the ball into the bottom right corner. What a finish that is!
Yellow card! It's like Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Peter Sippel agrees and books him.
Clinical finish! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) finds himself some space inside the box to control a rebound and blasts a low drive into the middle of the net, leaving the goalkeeper rooted to the spot.
Here comes a substitution. Ermin Bicakci (Braunschweig) has had enough and is replaced by Deniz Dogan (Braunschweig).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) for Mirko Boland.
That's the end of the game for Fabian Johnson, who is replaced by Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim).
It's time for a substitution. Bruno Nazario (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Sejad Salihovic.
Substitution. Kevin Volland leaves the pitch and is replaced by Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim).
Bruno Nazario (Hoffenheim) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post. The ball goes out of play and it will be a corner kick.
Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Braunschweig) creates a yard of space for himself and tries an effort from the edge of the box, but it goes just wide of the left post.
Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) fires the ball from mid-range and it goes into the top of the net. What a hit! Pure magic.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Referee Thorsten Kinhofer blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Elkin Soto (Mainz) receives a superb cross, slips through the defence and sends the ball into the roof of the goal.

A neat pass is well received by Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) is quickest to the rebound inside the penalty area, and he plants a header low into the middle of the net.
A header by Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) from very close range goes towards the right-hand post, but doesn't get past Loris Karius, who makes a brilliant save.

Johannes Geis (Mainz) takes the mid-range free kick and sends it towards the roof of the net, but he is denied by the goalkeeper. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Mainz will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Thorsten Kinhofer blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Johannes Geis (Mainz) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the crossbar, but Rene Adler easily deals with the threat. The ball goes out of play and Mainz have been awarded a corner kick.

Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 22 metres out. Loris Karius stops the effort which is headed for the bottom right corner. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Hamburger SV.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger), whose header flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Goal - 2:1! Yunus Malli (Mainz) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Ja-Cheol Koo provided an assist for the goal.
Substitution. Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Pierre-Michel Lasogga walks off.
Substitution. Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) in, Robert Tesche out.
An amazing individual effort from Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the roof of the net and makes it 3:1. Rene Adler was helpless.
Elkin Soto goes off the pitch and Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) comes on.
Here comes a substitution. Marcell Jansen (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Rafael van der Vaart.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nicolai Muller (Mainz) is coming onto the pitch as Ja-Cheol Koo cannot continue after picking up an injury.
It's in the back of the net! Petr Jiracek plays it into the box, and Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the bottom right corner. 3:2.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Yunus Malli will be replaced by Niko Bungert (Mainz).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Felix Zwayer checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Joel Matip (Schalke) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header perfectly into the left side of the goal. He makes it 1:0.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Markus Feulner leaves the pitch to be replaced by Antonio-Mirko Colak (Nurnberg).
Martin Angha (Nurnberg) tries his luck with a shot from long range, and his superb effort rattles the right post!

Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Patrick Rakovsky, who pulls off a comfortable save!
Tobias Pachonik (Nurnberg) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Mike Frantz (Nurnberg) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the left post.
The foul by Per Nilsson (Nurnberg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer.
After a goalmouth scramble the ball rebounds out to Roman Neustadter (Schalke) who buries it from close range straight into the bottom right corner.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Felix Zwayer blows his whistle to start the second half.

OFF THE POST! Max Meyer (Schalke) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Nurnberg.

Golden chance! Mike Frantz (Nurnberg) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
This should have been a goal! Julian Draxler (Schalke) sends a killer pass into the box, but Saed Kolasinac (Schalke) can't trick the opposition's defence and loses possession.
Niklas Stark (Nurnberg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Zwayer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Hanno Balitsch will be replaced by Sinan Tekerci (Nurnberg).
Today's referee Felix Zwayer rightly decides to book Mike Frantz (Nurnberg) for his harsh tackle.
A substitution has been made. Adam Hlousek is replaced by Robert Mak (Nurnberg).
We are about to witness a substitution. Jan Kirchhoff (Schalke) is replacing Adam Szalai.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) perfectly wriggles his way through two or three opponents, and he produces a low drive from the edge of the box which goes inside the right post. Wonderful goal!
Antonio-Mirko Colak (Nurnberg) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the right post. His effort, however, is blocked by Ralf Fahrmann, who pulls off a stunning save!
The manager has decided to substitute Max Meyer (Schalke) and he has been replaced by Chinedu Obasi (Schalke).
Tim Hoogland comes off the pitch to be replaced by Benedikt Howedes (Schalke).

Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Patrick Rakovsky makes a comfortable save to stop the effort from flying into the middle of the goal. Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) blows an opportunity as he sends a rebound from just outside of the box narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Nurnberg will have a goal kick.

Patrick Rakovsky was forced into action to thwart Julian Draxler (Schalke). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper.

Benedikt Howedes (Schalke) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the middle of the goal. Patrick Rakovsky is alert, though, and makes an easy save to deny him.

Leon Goretzka (Schalke) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Patrick Rakovsky shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Sinan Tekerci (Nurnberg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
Goal! Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:1.

Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) scores a goal! He makes his way to the edge of the box without any help from his teammates and drills a shot that ends in the left side of the goal, bouncing in off the post.
Felix Zwayer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Wolfgang Stark had an easy-decision to make.

Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the top of the net. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save. The linesman makes the right call and Wolfsburg will have a corner.

Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Marc-Andre ter Stegen is just a bystander as the ball flies into bottom right corner. The score is 1:0.
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) unleashes a brilliant effort from the free kick, but the ball crashes against the bar. What a chance!

Nice individual effort by Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom left corner, but Diego Benaglio does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out. B. Monchengladbach earn a corner.

Naldo (Wolfsburg) wastes a great chance from the resulting corner. He times his header superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross, but can't aim better than into the middle of the goal, straight into the arms of the goalkeeper.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Alvaro Dominguez.
The whistle blows and Wolfgang Stark starts the second half.
What was Naldo (Wolfsburg) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Post! Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
Goal - 1:1! Raffael laid the ball off to Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Martin Stranzl (B. Monchengladbach) was quite harsh and Wolfgang Stark didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the roof of the net, and thus alter the score to 1:0.
Substitution. Havard Nordtveit leaves the pitch and is replaced by Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Vieirinha will be replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
Here's the change. Juan Arango leaves the pitch and Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
Gooal! Ricardo Rodriguez takes over corner duties. Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the top right corner. 3:1.

Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jan Polak (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Ivan Perisic can be given a rest.
Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) has tested the patience of referee Wolfgang Stark and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Diego Benaglio pulls off a great save to deny Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. The ball goes behind for a corner. B. Monchengladbach will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
A substitution has been made. Kevin De Bruyne is replaced by Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg).
That's it for today, Wolfgang Stark has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom right corner. Marc-Andre ter Stegen is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save.
Martin Stranzl (B. Monchengladbach) finds some space inside the box and scores with a terrific header inside the right post, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Christoph Moritz (Mainz) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his strike flies just a few inches over the bar.

Elkin Soto (Mainz) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the right post, but Marc-Andre ter Stegen is prepared and dives to thwart him. The ball is out of play and Mainz manage to earn a corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Felix Zwayer starts the second half.

CHANCE! Elkin Soto (Mainz) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a sublime shot to the left side of the goal, but Marc-Andre ter Stegen produces an excellent save. The ball is out of play. Mainz win a corner kick.
Goal - 2:0! Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Patrick Herrmann provided an assist for the goal.
What a chance that is! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header crashes off the crossbar!

Zdenek Pospech sends a superb cross into the box. Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the right post, leaving Marc-Andre ter Stegen beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christoph Moritz trots off the pitch and is replaced by Yunus Malli (Mainz).

A wonderful pass found its target. Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) received it well and shot from about 16 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and into the bottom left corner.
Substitution. Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz) on for Johannes Geis.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Niko Bungert departs the field of play to be replaced by Benedikt Saller (Mainz).
Here comes a substitution. Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) has had enough and is replaced by Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach).
Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Julian Korb.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Raffael will be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
That's the end of the match.
Christian Dingert checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.

Sascha Molders (Augsburg) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Braunschweig will have a goal kick.
That's a clear yellow card. Kevin Kratz (Braunschweig) goes into the book.

Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Braunschweig) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort. Braunschweig will take a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Christian Dingert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.
Good team movement sets up Daniel Baier (Augsburg) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Tobias Werner (Augsburg) is leaving the pitch, and Andre Hahn (Augsburg) will replace him.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots to the right post, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Daniel Davari. What a save!
The game has come to an end for Jan Hochscheidt. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Orhan Ademi (Braunschweig).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) will replace Sascha Molders.
The referee signals a substitution. Marc Pfitzner (Braunschweig) is brought on as a substitute for Kevin Kratz.
What a strike! Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) hits the left post from the free kick.
A yellow card is awarded to Benjamin Kessel (Braunschweig).
Substitution. Dominik Kohr makes way for Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
Mirko Boland (Braunschweig) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the right post! What a shot that was!
Here comes a substitution. Karim Bellarabi (Braunschweig) has had enough and is replaced by Salim Khelifi (Braunschweig).

Marwin Hitz is a nightmare for the offensive players! Salim Khelifi (Braunschweig) meets a cross on the edge of the penalty area, takes a good first touch and fires a rocket of a shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper produces a wonderful save. Braunschweig have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Goal! Andre Hahn slips it to Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) on the edge of the box and he finds the top of the net with a great effort. The score is 0:1.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) is cautioned and receives a yellow card.
Christian Dingert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball inside the right post.
What a great touch by Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
Jens Grahl pulls off a great save to deny Marco Reus (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.

Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) scores a splendid goal as he finishes his great individual effort with a venomous shot from around 20 metres out into the bottom right corner. Take a bow son. The score is now 1:1.

Marco Reus showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the middle of the goal. It's 2:1.
The foul by Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Welz.
Goal! Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 3:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Tarik Elyounoussi.

What a big chance! Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Joseph-Claude Gyau (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch for Eugen Polanski.
What a howler by the goalkeeper. Niklas Sle (Hoffenheim) unleashed a long-range low drive towards the middle of the net and beats the goalkeeper. A school boy's error.
Substitution. Marco Reus is replaced by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund).
Substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan walks off the pitch and Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Tobias Strobl will be replaced by Bruno Nazario (Hoffenheim).
It will be a substitution. Julian Schieber (Dortmund) is ready to enter the pitch as Robert Lewandowski walks off.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target.
Eren Derdiyok feeds the ball through to Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the right side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:0!
Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt) blows a huge opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the side into the penalty area and sends a bullet header which goes just wide of the left post!
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
A rebound finds its way to Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) and he scores with a powerful strike, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The end of the first half.
Jochen Drees blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The referee signals a substitution. Jan Rosenthal (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Marc Stendera.
It will be a substitution. Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) is ready to enter the pitch as Julian Brandt walks off.
Jochen Drees saw it clearly and pulls out a yellow card.

Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt) peels away from his marker to get on the end of a cross and sends a header towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls of a decent save. The ball goes out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt are awarded a corner kick.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Carlos Zambrano comes off the pitch to be replaced by Pirmin Schwegler (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Heung-Min Son departs the field of play to be replaced by Sidney Sam (Bayer Leverkusen).
Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) receives the ball from the resulting free kick and unleashes a strike from the edge of the box. But his effort goes just over the crossbar!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Stefano Celozzi (Eintracht Frankfurt) is coming onto the pitch as Sebastian Jung cannot continue after picking up an injury.
We are about to witness a substitution. Andres Guardado (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Gonzalo Castro.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.

Great ball in from Karim Guede. Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.

Roman Neustadter looks around to decide who he is going to pass to. He picks out Kaan Ayhan (Schalke), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from just outside of the box towards the bottom right corner and it ricochets in off the post. The score is 0:1.
The foul by Karim Guede (Freiburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Florian Meyer.
Kaan Ayhan (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Florian Meyer ignores the protests.
Wow, what an escape. Felix Klaus (Freiburg) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. Freiburg will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) wastes a promising chance as he unleashes a first-time shot from mid-range which hits the crossbar!
Golden chance! Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Florian Meyer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Substitution. Jonathan Schmid makes his way off the pitch and Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) comes on as his replacement.
Referee Florian Meyer blows his whistle to start the second half.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Kaan Ayhan as he is replaced by Marco Hoger (Schalke).
Felipe Santana (Schalke) covers his face with his hands after spurning a great chance. The ball rebounded to him but his close-range header went a whisker over the crossbar.

Julian Draxler (Schalke) takes the ball and sets it for the free kick. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross from the free kick into the box and attempts to score with a header. His effort is not accurate enough and bounces away off the bar.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) creates some space for himself just outside the penalty area after getting on the end of an amazing pass and smashes the ball into the back of the net!
It's a yellow card for Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke).
Here comes a substitution. Karim Guede is given a rest as he is replaced by Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg).
Florian Meyer shows the yellow card to Felipe Santana (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Julian Schuster (Freiburg) gets booked.
Felipe Santana (Schalke) receives a yellow card from Florian Meyer and because it's his second he will have an early bath.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Max Meyer will be replaced by Jan Kirchhoff (Schalke).
It will be a substitution. Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) is ready to enter the pitch as Julian Draxler walks off.
Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) latched on to an accurate pass deep into the box and attempted to fire the ball past the keeper, but the shot is way off target. What a miskick!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the left post. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich will have a goal kick.
Goal - 0:1! Arjen Robben laid the ball off to Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

What a huge chance for Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV will have a goal kick.

Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the roof of the net. Manuel Neuer is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. Corner kick. Hamburger SV will have an opportunity.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Marco Fritz starts the second half.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) reacts quickly in the penalty area and scores with aplomb, giving the goalkeeper no chance!

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) receives the ball inside the penalty box and immediately fires a first-time effort, but it goes well over the top. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.
Substitution. Dennis Diekmeier leaves the pitch and is replaced by Ola John (Hamburger).
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.

Manuel Neuer makes a brilliant save! Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper into the middle of the goal. The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV have been awarded a corner kick.

Michael Ian Mancienne (Hamburger) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Bayern Munich will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Toni Kroos makes way for Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Bayern Munich).
Here's the change. Rafael van der Vaart leaves the pitch and Kerem Demirbay (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
Great chance! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Goal! Thomas Muller displays great vision and sends a pass to Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:3.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) perfectly wriggles his way through two or three opponents, and he produces a low drive from the edge of the box which goes inside the right post. Wonderful goal!
Substitution. Arjen Robben will be replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich).
Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Rene Adler.
Goal! Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:4.
Substitution. Heiko Westermann walks off the pitch and Jonathan Tah (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
What a big chance! Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
The referee Marco Fritz awards Kerem Demirbay (Hamburger) a yellow card.
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) is sent off! He receives a red card and the match ends for him. He attempts to argue, but the decision Marco Fritz has made is final.
That's it for today, Marco Fritz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal! Artjoms Rudnevs tees up Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the left side of the goal. 0:1.

Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Ron-Robert Zieler anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the bottom left corner. The referee signals a corner kick to Nurnberg.
Timothy Chandler (Nurnberg) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) is the one who receives a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Manuel Grafe blows his whistle to start the second half.
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) displays great tekkers inside the box leading to a fantastic goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
A yellow card for a tackle by Javier Pinola (Nurnberg). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Hannover have an opportunity from a mid-range free kick.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Marvin Plattenhardt (Nurnberg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Niklas Stark (Nurnberg) comes onto the pitch for Mike Frantz.
The manager makes a subsitution with Antonio-Mirko Colak (Nurnberg) coming on for Tomas Pekhart.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Tim Dierssen (Hannover) replacing Leon Andreasen (Hannover).
The substitution is prepared. Valmir Sulejmani (Hannover) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Artjoms Rudnevs.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Felix Brych checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the top right corner. It's 0:1.
Diego Benaglio pulls off a great save to deny Cacau (VfB Stuttgart), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal. Stuttgart earn a corner.

Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though. The ball goes out of play and Wolfsburg will have a goal kick.
The match has reached half-time.
Felix Brych blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Jan Polak (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Felix Brych after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daniel Didavi leaves the pitch and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
It's in the back of the net! Cacau slips the ball through to Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ivan Perisic trots off the pitch and is replaced by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).

Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him. The ball goes out of play and Wolfsburg will have a goal kick.
Maximilian Arnold will be replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
Here comes a substitution. Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) has had enough and is replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).

Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the left post. Sven Ulreich guesses his intentions and denies him with a fine save.
Today's referee Felix Brych rightly decides to book Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) for his harsh tackle.
Daniel Schwaab has picked up an injury and is replaced by Arthur Boka (VfB Stuttgart).
Goal - 1:2! Vieirinha laid the ball off to Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Substitution. Kevin De Bruyne did his best and is replaced by Slobodan Medojevic (Wolfsburg).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Robert Hartmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the middle of the goal, but Raphael Wolf pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.

Golden chance! Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Robert Hartmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Goal! Aaron Hunt (Werder Bremen) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the top right corner. Franco Di Santo assisted in the goal. 0:0.
John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Hartmann had an easy-decision to make.

Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort flies narrowly over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Adrian Ramos will be replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
The substitution is prepared. Hany Mukhtar (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ronny.
The referee shows a yellow card to Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen). No wonder. A clear yellow for bad language.

What a chance by Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball goes inches over the crossbar. The ball is out of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) in, Zlatko Junuzovic out.
Substitution. Sami Allagui walks off the pitch and Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Franco Di Santo is replaced by Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) on for Eljero Elia.
Wonderful movement! Aaron Hunt (Werder Bremen) makes a good run to pick up a cross on the edge of the box and curls the ball into the roof of the net.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.

Ralf Fahrmann was forced into action to thwart Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper. The referee signals a corner kick to B. Monchengladbach.
Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) attempts to score with a first-time shot from the edge of the box. His effort towards the roof of the net is saved by Marc-Andre ter Stegen. Schalke win a corner.

0:1. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a pass on the edge of the penalty area and immediately fires a fantastic first-time shot into the left side of the net. What a finish that is! Ralf Fahrmann did his best to stop it, but the shot was just too good. Raffael provided the assistance.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Manuel Grafe starts the second half.

What a huge chance for Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) is coming onto the pitch as Max Meyer cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) comes onto the pitch for Tim Hoogland.
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make. B. Monchengladbach get a free kick.
A substitution has been made. Raffael is replaced by Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach).

OFF THE POST! Adam Szalai (Schalke) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kaan Ayhan trots off the pitch and is replaced by Felipe Santana (Schalke).
Substitution. Lukas Rupp (B. Monchengladbach) in, Patrick Herrmann out.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) picks up a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Max Kruse departs the field of play to be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).

What a big chance! Julian Draxler (Schalke) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for B. Monchengladbach.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Augsburg) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Goal - 1:0! Halil Altintop (Augsburg) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the right post. Paul Verhaegh provided an assist for the goal.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) takes the resulting free kick from 18 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the bottom left corner, but Marwin Hitz is alert and keeps the ball out.

Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) wasted a huge opportunity! He received a fine cross from the free kick and fired a decent shot in from close range. Unfortunately for him, it sailed just over the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and Augsburg will have a goal kick.
What a goal! Andre Hahn plays it to Halil Altintop (Augsburg), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Rene Adler low into the middle of the net. 2:0.
A wonderful pass found its target. Andre Hahn (Augsburg) received it well and shot from about 25 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and inside the right post.

It's in the back of the net! Hakan Calhanoglu flights the free kick into the box, where Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) peels off his marker and heads it straight into the bottom right corner from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 3:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Tobias Welz blows his whistle to start the second half.
Here's the change. Kevin Vogt leaves the pitch and Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) comes on as a substitute.

What a big chance! Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hamburger SV.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Welz had an easy-decision to make.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) replacing Mattia Maggio (Hamburger).
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Rene Adler makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal.

Halil Altintop (Augsburg) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header just wide of the left post! The ball goes out of play and Hamburger SV will have a goal kick.
Close! Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcell Jansen leaves the pitch and Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) comes on.
Substitution. Sascha Molders walks off the pitch and Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) comes on as a substitute.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kerem Demirbay (Hamburger) will replace Milan Badelj.
Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Rene Adler guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Substitution. Alexander Esswein leaves the pitch and is replaced by Tobias Werner (Augsburg).

Marwin Hitz gets a well deserved ovation! Tomas Rincon (Hamburger) produces a decent first-time strike towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills. The referee blows his whistle, Hamburger SV are awarded a corner kick.
That's it for today, Tobias Welz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Bernd Leno pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) meets a delivery on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the top right corner. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Roman Weidenfeller pulls off an easy save. The ball is out of play and Bayer Leverkusen manage to earn a corner.
OFF THE BAR! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) outjumps the defence to connect with the resulting corner and attempts to head home, but his effort only crashes against the crossbar.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) scores with a header from inside the box after a goalmouth scramble.
This shall not pass! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) lines up a shot from the edge of the box and goes for goal, but the effort is well blocked by a defender.
That's a well-taken pass by Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen). He unleashes a strike from the edge of the box, but blazes it high over the bar.
GOAL! Marco Reus curls the free kick into the box. Oliver Kirch (Dortmund) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past Bernd Leno and into the right side of the net. 1:1.
Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) heads the ball low inside the right post after a splendid cross. This timely header produces a wonderful moment.
Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) handles the ball inside the penalty area. Dortmund are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) unleashes a strong shot and sends the goalkeeper the wrong way. An easy goal.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Dortmund.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Gunter Perl blows his whistle to start the second half.
Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Gunter Perl had an easy-decision to make.
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) shows good awareness deep inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks accuracy and flies well over the crossbar.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) connects with the corner but his looping header goes well over.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the left post by a whisker.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) tries his luck from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort, but it is well blocked by the defender.
Excellent touch by Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen)! He latches on to a precise pass on the edge of the box but miskicks and the ball goes well wide of the right post. Poor effort.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Here comes a substitution. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) is brought on as a substitute for Henrikh Mkhitaryan.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Gonzalo Castro walks off the pitch to be replaced by Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Julian Brandt is replaced by Levin Oztunali (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Milos Jojic can be given a rest.
Stefan Kiessling is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen).
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) receives a nice lofted pass and rips a snap shot from the edge of the box. His kick misses the goal and flies high over the crossbar.
Robert Lewandowski goes off the pitch and Julian Schieber (Dortmund) comes on.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball in the middle of the goal.
Goal! Claudio Pizarro produces a great pass that finds Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) blows a good chance to score. He collects a pass inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the goal is brilliantly blocked. Great defending!
Aaron Hunt (Werder Bremen) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Manuel Neuer with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:2.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Guido Winkmann has ended it.
Substitution. Mitchell Weiser will be replaced by Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich).
Referee Guido Winkmann blows his whistle to start the second half.

Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Raphael Wolf leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Goal - 1:2! Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass inside the box from Thomas Muller and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Aleksandar Ignjovski (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch so that Cedric Makiadi can be given a rest.
Goal! David Alaba rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 3:2.

Raphael Wolf pulls off a great save to deny Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner. The ball goes out of play. Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.

It's a goal! Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) makes it 1:2. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Philipp Lahm and planted his close-range header into the top right corner. Raphael Wolf was helpless.

Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) has a big opportunity to score! He climbs highest deep inside the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the goal. Next time he should aim better as his effort flies narrowly over the bar.
Here comes a substitution. Franco Di Santo is given a rest as he is replaced by Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen).
We are about to witness a substitution. Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) is replacing Dante.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) perfectly wriggles his way through two or three opponents, and he produces a low drive from the edge of the box which goes inside the left post. Wonderful goal!
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Diego Contento (Bayern Munich) in, David Alaba out.
Wow, what an escape. Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. Bayern Munich will take a corner kick.
Substitution. Aaron Hunt is replaced by Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen).
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) rises high to connect with a cross from the corner kick, but his powerful header from near the penalty spot crashes against the crossbar!
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

Ambitious effort from Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well wide of the right post. The linesman points to the corner flag, Hertha Berlin are going to take it.
Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Daniel Davari pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
It is time for a substitution. Karim Bellarabi (Braunschweig) is on for Jan Hochscheidt.
The whistle blows and Thorsten Kinhofer starts the second half.
Dominick Kumbela (Braunschweig) latches on to a through ball inside the box, but one of the defenders steps in with a timely interception. It could have been a great chance otherwise.

Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Braunschweig.
John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) scores! He won himself some space inside the box after a cross from the corner kick and blasts the ball into the net. His effort went inside the left post.
Substitution. Per Skjelbred makes way for Ronny (Hertha Berlin).
The substitution is prepared. Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Sandro Wagner.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Tolga Cigerci walks off the pitch to be replaced by Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin).
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) is unlucky with a low drive from the edge of the box. A decent save by Daniel Davari stops the ball from hitting the middle of the net.
Goal! Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:0.
The substitution has been made. Benjamin Kessel (Braunschweig) has replaced Omar Elabdellaoui.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marc Pfitzner (Braunschweig) comes onto the pitch so that Ken Reichel can be given a rest.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Florian Meyer checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.

Unbelievable miss! Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.
Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Florian Meyer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. He sends the ball into orbit. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.

Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) receives the ball inside the penalty box and immediately fires a first-time effort, but it goes well over the top. The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.
Tranquillo Barnetta (Eintracht Frankfurt) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Stephan Schrock (Eintracht Frankfurt) will take his place on the pitch.
Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and drills a shot to the bottom right corner, but is denied by a reflex save from Jens Grahl.

CHANCE! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top. The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.

Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) latched on to a good low pass and attempted to surprise the goalkeeper with a snap shot, but the ball skewed off his foot flew well over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Florian Meyer starts the second half.

Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
CLOSE! Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that whistles over the bar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Joseph-Claude Gyau (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch for Kai Herdling.
Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make.
A substitution has been made. Stefan Aigner goes off and Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Stephan Schrock (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Florian Meyer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Kevin Trapp stops the ball from going inside the left post.
Kevin Trapp (Eintracht Frankfurt) trips an opposition player and Florian Meyer signals a foul. PENALTY! One of the players from Hoffenheim is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Kevin Trapp (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the left post, but Kevin Trapp leaps out to thwart his attempt.
Florian Meyer shows a red card with no hesitation. Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) can have an early bath and think about his challenge.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Referee Knut Kircher blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) celebrates a beautiful goal. He wins the ball inside the box from the free kick and plants a header inside the left post. 1:0.
Elkin Soto (Mainz) fails to turn the rebound in as the goalkeeper pulls off a great save to keep him out.
Christoph Moritz (Mainz) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Yunus Malli (Mainz), whose header flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) collects a wonderful lead pass and creates some space to smash the ball goalwards from long range. His shot goes painfully wide of the left post!
Christoph Moritz (Mainz) gets to the ball after a big mistake by the defender and scores with a precise shot into the bottom left corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Knut Kircher blows his whistle to start the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Martin Angha (Nurnberg) replaces Timothy Chandler.
Martin Angha (Nurnberg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
OFF THE POST! Johannes Geis (Mainz) produces a thunderbolt of a strike from distance, but his effort rattles the left post!
Niklas Stark (Nurnberg) blows an opportunity as he sends a rebound from just outside of the box narrowly wide of the left post.
