Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. Mainz get a corner.

Ambitious effort from Josip Drmic (Nurnberg). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well wide of the left post.
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Nurnberg) has tested the patience of referee Knut Kircher and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Robert Mak is replaced by Adam Hlousek (Nurnberg).

Yunus Malli (Mainz) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Raphael Schafer, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Mainz will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Here's the change. Niklas Stark leaves the pitch and Antonio-Mirko Colak (Nurnberg) comes on as a substitute.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) has a shot blocked, it rebounds back to him, but even on his second attempt he cannot hit the target. His effort goes well wide.
Elkin Soto just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) replaces him.

Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save. The ball is out of play. Nurnberg will have a chance to score from a corner.

Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) receives a lofted pass and is given time inside the box to unleash a shot goalwards. The ball is directed towards the middle of the goal, but it lacks power and Loris Karius pulls off a comfortable save to thwart the effort.
Substitution. Yunus Malli will be replaced by Julian Baumgartlinger (Mainz).
The substitution is prepared. Todor Nedelev (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Shinji Okazaki.
Mike Frantz (Nurnberg) collects a wonderful lead pass and as he has a lot of space, smashes a terrific shot from long range. His shot goes painfully close to the crossbar!
Knut Kircher is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) for a heavy challenge. Wolfsburg win a free kick.

Superbly taken set piece! Ricardo Rodriguez takes the resulting free kick and sends a cross into the six-yard box. Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) flicks the ball lightly with his head towards the top left corner. Oliver Baumann can't react quickly enough and the score changes to 1:0.

Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom left corner, but Oliver Baumann pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. Wolfsburg force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) fires a brilliant shot in from 22 metres out, but the effort rattles the crossbar! It could have been a superb goal.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Oliver Baumann guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Deniz Aytekin has ended it.
Referee Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle to start the second half.

Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the top left corner. Unfortunately for him, Oliver Baumann makes a great save to stop his effort. Wolfsburg force a corner. They send men into the box.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) strikes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box and it goes straight inside the left post!
A substitution has been made. Slobodan Medojevic is replaced by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg).
Goal! Christian Trasch plays a pass to the feet of Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 2:1.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg).

What a great touch by Karim Guede (Freiburg) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot towards the roof of the net, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. Freiburg earn a corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg) is coming onto the pitch as Sebastian Kerk cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) sends in a direct shot from a dangerously positioned free kick. The ball sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Freiburg.
It's time for a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Ivica Olic.
Goal - 2:2! Christian Gunter laid the ball off to Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg), who shot from close range into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The manager has decided to substitute Karim Guede (Freiburg) and he has been replaced by Sebastien Freis (Freiburg).

Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the left side of the target, but Oliver Baumann keeps the ball out. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Wolfsburg.
Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg) gets a yellow card. The referee Deniz Aytekin made the right call.
It will be a substitution. Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Christian Gunter walks off.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball, though, only brushes the left post.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Ibrahima Traore slides a brilliant pass into Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
The referee Wolfgang Stark awards Marcelo (Hannover) a yellow card.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) gets a yellow card.
Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover) comes onto the pitch after Didier Ya Konan signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) rips an amazing volley from deep inside the box that goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.
The manager makes a subsitution with Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) coming on for Cacau.
A substitution has been made. Jan Schlaudraff is replaced by Valmir Sulejmani (Hannover).
Martin Harnik just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) replaces him.
Wolfgang Stark shows the yellow card to Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover) for a heavy challenge.
Here comes a substitution. Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) has had enough and is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).

Lars Stindl (Hannover) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Sven Ulreich makes a great save to stop the effort going low into the middle of the goal.
Substitution. Tim Dierssen (Hannover) on for Szabolcs Huszti.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Perfectly taken free kick! Daniel Didavi sends a cross in and Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the middle of the net and the score changes to 1:0.
Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Gunter Perl didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Gunter Perl shows a yellow card to Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) for a tough tackle.

Ambitious effort from Cacau (VfB Stuttgart). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.
Today's referee Gunter Perl rightly decides to book Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) for his harsh tackle.

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) tries his luck from a long-range free kick and the ball is aimed to the bottom right corner, but Ralf Fahrmann is alert and thwarts the effort. The referee signals a corner kick to Stuttgart.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Gunter Perl starts the second half.

Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post! The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart will have a goal kick.
The foul by Carlos Gruezo (VfB Stuttgart) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Gunter Perl.

It's in the back of the net! Ibrahima Traore sends a superb cross into the box. Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header low inside the right post, leaving Ralf Fahrmann beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke trots off the pitch and is replaced by Adam Szalai (Schalke).
Goal! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Gotoku Sakai, then sends the ball into the middle of the net. 3:0.
Goal - 3:1! Adam Szalai (Schalke) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Leon Goretzka provided an assist for the goal.

What a save from Sven Ulreich! Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out. The ball goes out of play and Schalke have been awarded a corner kick.
The manager makes a subsitution with Konstantin Rausch (VfB Stuttgart) coming on for Carlos Gruezo.
Joel Matip (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Gunter Perl ignores the protests.
Max Meyer goes off the pitch and Leroy Sane (Schalke) comes on.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Daniel Didavi walks off the pitch to be replaced by Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart).
Unbelievable miss! Joel Matip (Schalke) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Felipe Santana (Schalke) replaces Sead Kolasinac.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Karim Haggui (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Cacau cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes into the bottom left corner. It's 0:1.

Jose Campana (Nurnberg) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Nurnberg) beats the keeper with a stunning low drive from a long-range free kick into the bottom left corner. Truly outstanding!
Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) finds himself some space on the edge of the box to meet a cross from the free kick, but his header hits the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Marco Fritz blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Hiroshi Kiyotake (Nurnberg) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball down to the middle of the goal. Bernd Leno shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Today's referee Marco Fritz rightly decides to book Marvin Plattenhardt (Nurnberg) for his harsh tackle.
Goal - 1:1! Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass inside the box from Omer Toprak and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.

Raphael Schafer pulls off a great save to deny Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The referee blows his whistle, Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
The foul by Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz. Nurnberg are given an advantage. They have a free kick.
Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Lars Bender, but he hits a shot just wide of the left post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Antonio-Mirko Colak (Nurnberg) comes onto the pitch so that Hiroshi Kiyotake can be given a rest.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Gonzalo Castro walks off the pitch and Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.

Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but his shot missed the target close to the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Nurnberg.
Goal! Heung-Min Son passes the ball to the feet of Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 1:3.

Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and fires the ball into the bottom right corner of the target, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
It will be a substitution. Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) is ready to enter the pitch as Stefan Kiessling walks off.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Brilliant finish! Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) perfectly collected a pass from Luiz Gustavo, then produced a brilliant long-range strike which went low into the middle of the net. The score is 0:1.
Wasted opportunity. Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) gets to the rebound inside the box and smashes the ball just wide of the right post.

Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Wolfsburg will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Goal! Ivica Olic produces a great pass that finds Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom right corner. 0:2.
Peter Sippel has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Peter Sippel blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal - 0:3! Naldo laid the ball off to Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg), who shot from close range into the top right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the roof of the net, but Max Grun made a crucial save! Now Hamburger SV have a corner.
Substitution. Tolgay Arslan will be replaced by Ola John (Hamburger).
Goal! Robert Tesche provides Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom right corner. 1:3.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Peter Sippel ignores the protests. Hamburger SV are awarded a mid-range free kick.

OFF THE POST! Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
It is time for a substitution. Kerem Demirbay (Hamburger) is on for Tomas Rincon.
Substitution. Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) has come on for Maximilian Arnold.

Nice individual effort by Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom right corner, but Rene Adler does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out. The ball goes behind for a corner. Wolfsburg will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch for Ivica Olic.
Substitution. Jan Polak makes way for Slobodan Medojevic (Wolfsburg).
Here's the change. Ivo Ilicevic leaves the pitch and Mattia Maggio (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) goes on a mazy run, gets into the box and from around the penalty spot he misses the target. What a chance that was!
Peter Sippel shows a yellow card to Robert Tesche (Hamburger) for a tough tackle.
This was really stupid from Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg)! He is booked for the second time today and is forced to leave the pitch after seeing a red card in the hand of Peter Sippel.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Referee Jochen Drees blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) fails to send a pass into the box. His effort is cut out.
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save.
Sascha Molders (Augsburg) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches wide of the left post.

Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick low shot towards the middle of the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows Marwin Hitz to make a comfortable save.
Jochen Drees has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Jochen Drees blows his whistle to start the second half.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Augsburg) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Andre Hahn (Augsburg) will replace Tobias Werner.

John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) receives the ball inside the box from the resulting free kick, but fails to score as his shot is blocked by one of the defenders. Corner kick. Hertha Berlin will have an opportunity.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin).
Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Jochen Drees and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
We are about to witness a substitution. Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) is replacing Sami Allagui.
Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) has a sight of goal and shoots from long range but his ambitious effort flies just over the bar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) replaces Sascha Molders.
Here's the change. Marcel N'Djeng leaves the pitch and Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.
Here comes a substitution. Halil Altintop is given a rest as he is replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
It is time for a substitution. Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) is on for Per Skjelbred.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Great ball in from Omar Elabdellaoui. Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.

Arjen Robben sprays a wonderful pass out to Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Bayern Munich), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Daniel Davari problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Braunschweig will have a goal kick.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Nicky Siebert has ended it.
Referee Nicky Siebert blows his whistle to start the second half.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) was quite harsh and Nicky Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jan Hochscheidt leaves the pitch and Marco Caligiuri (Braunschweig) comes on.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) for Franck Ribery.
That's the end of the game for Arjen Robben, who is replaced by Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marc Pfitzner (Braunschweig) will replace Kevin Kratz.
Goal - 0:1! Mario Gotze laid the ball off to Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich), who shot from close range into the left side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Nicky Siebert shows a yellow card to Matthias Henn (Braunschweig) for a tough tackle.
Dennis Kruppke comes off the pitch to be replaced by Orhan Ademi (Braunschweig).
A nice goal by Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich)! He coolly drilled a low shot deep inside the left post.
It will be a substitution. Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) is ready to enter the pitch as Philipp Lahm walks off.
A yellow card is awarded to Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich).
Nicky Siebert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Referee Markus Schmidt blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) executes a long-range free kick. His well-taken effort flies only inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day.
After a goalmouth scramble Milos Jojic (Dortmund) wins the ball and unleashes a powerful and precise effort into the back of the net, beating the helpless goalkeeper. A wonderful football moment.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Milos Jojic (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Markus Schmidt didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan produces a sweet pass and picks out Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:1!

Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) is picked up by one of his teammates with a brilliant low pass, but he doesn't receive the ball well. The defence eliminates the danger without any problem. He could have found himself in a good chance to score.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) connects with a cross from the side, but produces a header which goes miles wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Dortmund will have a goal kick.
What a great effort! Yunus Malli (Mainz) decides to unleash a long-range shot. Despite hitting it very well, it scorches inches over the crossbar. We could have witnessed a magnificent goal.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Markus Schmidt had an easy-decision to make.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Markus Schmidt has ended it.
Referee Markus Schmidt blows his whistle to start the second half.
The game has come to an end for Christoph Moritz. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Benedikt Saller (Mainz).
The substitution is prepared. Shawn Parker (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Stefan Bell.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Loris Karius.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) tries his luck from a long-range free kick and fires the ball to the left side of the goal, but Loris Karius is alert and thwarts the effort. Dortmund have a corner.

Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort. The linesman points to the corner flag, Dortmund are going to take it.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) has a great chance inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.

Perfectly executed free kick. Marco Reus floats the ball in and Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) leaps high to connect with it near the penalty spot. His bullet header flicks off the post into the right side of the goal. The score is now 3:2.
Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. The ball would have probably ended inside the right post, if Loris Karius hadn't made a superb save.
What a save from Loris Karius! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.

Sokratis (Dortmund) connects with the ball from the resulting corner on the edge of the penalty box and heads straight to the middle. However, the ball is cleared away by one of the defenders. Great reaction.
Yunus Malli goes off the pitch and Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) comes on.
Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) finds his way to the ball from the free kick inside the box, but his header only hits the left post.
Niko Bungert (Mainz) touches the ball with his hand.
Niko Bungert (Mainz) clatters into his opponent and is shown a red card by the referee! Despite protesting, he knows the match has ended for him. Dortmund are awarded a penalty kick!
Marco Reus (Dortmund) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the left post.
A substitution has been made. Henrikh Mkhitaryan is replaced by Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Milos Jojic trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marco Reus as he is replaced by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund).
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Loris Karius. Dortmund win a corner.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the bottom left corner, but he can't get the power to direct it past Loris Karius, who gets down to save. Dortmund force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
That's it for today, Markus Schmidt has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal! Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Juan Arango, then sends the ball low into the middle of the net. 0:1.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Peter Gagelmann blows his whistle to start the second half.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) receives a precise pass inside the box from Jonathan Schmid and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the left side of the net. 1:1.
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) has tested the patience of referee Peter Gagelmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch for Immanuel Hohn.
A player from Freiburg takes his opponent down, the referee blows his whistle for a foul. A penalty is given to B. Monchengladbach!

Filip Daems (B. Monchengladbach) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot into the bottom right corner. Oliver Baumann anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort. The referee points to the corner flag and B. Monchengladbach will take a corner.
Felix Klaus (Freiburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Peter Gagelmann had an easy-decision to make.

Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) does not realise that he has already received a yellow card and is shocked when the referee shows him a second one! Freiburg are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) goes into the referee's book for dissent.

Oliver Sorg (Freiburg) scores one of the best goals in his career. His rocket of a shot from distance goes straight into the top right corner. They will be showing this on every football show for some time to come.
Goal - 1:1! Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) receives a precise pass inside the box from Felix Klaus and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Patrick Herrmann will be replaced by Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Juan Arango will be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) replaces Felix Klaus.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Marc-Andre ter Stegen with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 4:1.
Oliver Sorg (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card for an infringement. B. Monchengladbach win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) proves that he is an excellent free-kick taker after finding the back of the net with a clever shot that goes straight into the bottom left corner!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Admir Mehmedi trots off the pitch and is replaced by Tim Schraml (Freiburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Bastian Dankert checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Goal - 0:1! Roberto Firmino laid the ball off to Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) is in the right place at the right time and perfectly hits a rebound into the top left corner.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Bastian Dankert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The substitution is prepared. Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Tobias Strobl.

Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the top left corner. Jens Grahl shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.

Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. His dangerous effort is blocked by Jens Grahl, who makes a glorious save!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch so that Tarik Elyounoussi can be given a rest.
Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Clemens Fritz has picked up an injury and is replaced by Aleksandar Ignjovski (Werder Bremen).
A brilliant individual effort! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header into the roof of the net from close range. The score is 2:1.
Jens Grahl (Hoffenheim) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) is leaving the pitch, and Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) will replace him.

Bastian Dankert blows his whistle after Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Hoffenheim.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Raphael Wolf dives to the left side of the goal and brilliantly saves the penalty taken by Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim)!
Substitution. Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) replaces Eljero Elia.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aaron Hunt departs the field of play to be replaced by Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen).
Goal! Franco Di Santo provides Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort under the bar. 3:1.
That's it for today, Bastian Dankert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Christian Pander sends a superb cross into the box. Leon Andreasen (Hannover) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving Kevin Trapp beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Goal! The ball from the resulting free kick arrives at the feet of Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt) inside the box, and he fires a lovely shot into the roof of the net.

Perfectly taken free kick! Christian Pander sends a cross in and Lars Stindl (Hannover) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the top left corner and the score changes to 1:2.
Goal! Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:3. He was ably assisted there by Leon Andreasen.
Stefan Aigner sprays a pass out to Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes high over the bar.
It's time for a substitution. Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on in place of Pirmin Schwegler.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Tranquillo Barnetta (Eintracht Frankfurt) failed to convert a long-range free kick and sends the ball narrowly over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.
The game is interrupted. Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
The match has reached half-time.
The game has come to an end for Leonardo Bittencourt. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Edgar Prib (Hannover).
The whistle blows and Felix Brych starts the second half.
POST! Leon Andreasen (Hannover) unleashes a thunderous effort from the edge of the box and the ball crashes against the left post. What a strike that was!
OFF THE BAR! Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.
Substitution. Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Tranquillo Barnetta walks off.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) gathers a nice lofted pass deep inside the box and attempts to put the ball into the middle of the goal, but his shot is deflected away by one of the defending players.
Great ball in from Sebastian Jung. Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the right post.

A perfect lofted pass from Stefan Aigner finds Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Ron-Robert Zieler had no chance of stopping that. 1:3.
Booking. Edgar Prib (Hannover) receives a caution from the referee.

Edgar Prib (Hannover) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Kevin Trapp guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Good work from Hannover as they win a corner.
The manager has decided to substitute Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) and he has been replaced by Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover).
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
We are about to witness a substitution. Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) is replacing Szabolcs Huszti.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Leon Andreasen (Hannover) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Ron-Robert Zieler (Hannover) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Sebastian Jung (Eintracht Frankfurt) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Lars Stindl (Hannover) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Kevin Trapp to get hold of the ball. The referee points to the corner flag and Hannover will take a corner.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

OFF THE POST! Sascha Molders (Augsburg) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save!
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) sends a 25-metre free kick inside the right post. That was too difficult for the goalkeeper to make a save.

Andre Hahn (Augsburg) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Jens Grahl pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Here comes a substitution. Dominik Kohr is given a rest as he is replaced by Kevin Vogt (Augsburg).
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Kevin Vogt (Augsburg) is given a yellow card.

Halil Altintop (Augsburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Jens Grahl is alert and denies him. Good work from Augsburg as they win a corner.
Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
The ball falls to Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim) after a few unlucky rebounds and he scores a simple header into the middle of the net.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Markus Schmidt has ended it.
The second half has just started.
Marwin Hitz pulls off a stunning save to block the free kick from Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim). The ball was heading towards the top left corner. The referee signals a corner kick to Hoffenheim.

Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Jens Grahl makes a great save to stop his effort. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sascha Molders trots off the pitch and is replaced by Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
A substitution has been made. Sejad Salihovic is replaced by Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim).

Golden chance! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.
The manager makes a subsitution with Raphael Holzhauser (Augsburg) coming on for Andre Hahn.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) is leaving the pitch, and Niklas Sle (Hoffenheim) will replace him.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends his bullet header just wide of the right post.
Substitution. Tarik Elyounoussi did his best and is replaced by Kai Herdling (Hoffenheim).

What a chance that is! Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Tobias Stieler checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps for a cross and plants a crashing header into the middle of the net. Even though the goalkeeper was standing near, he couldn't make a save.
Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
OFF THE WOODWORK! Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) surges forward and manages to get a powerful shot away from 30 metres out. However, the effort crashes against the bar!
Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
Wonderful movement! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a good run to pick up a cross on the edge of the box and curls the ball into the roof of the net.

It's in the back of the net! Tolga Cigerci flights the free kick into the box, where Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) peels off his marker and heads straight inside the upright from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 2:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Nico Schulz (Hertha Berlin) on for Anis Ben-Hatira.
We are about to witness a substitution. Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) is replacing Levan Kobiashvili.
What an amazing save by Thomas Kraft! Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the left side of the target, but fails.
It's time for a substitution. Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on in place of Gonzalo Castro.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ronny (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch so that Per Skjelbred can be given a rest.
Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Here comes a substitution. Levin Oztunali (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Julian Brandt.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground. Dortmund will look to benefit from a promising free kick near the touchline.
Marco Reus feeds the ball through to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the right side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:0!
Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) cracked a first-time shot, but the goalkeeper pulled off an amazing save.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Zwayer has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Manuel Neuer leaves the pitch to be replaced by Lukas Raeder (Bayern Munich).
Goal! Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang feeds Marco Reus (Dortmund), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 0:2.
Goal - 0:3! Sokratis laid the ball off to Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund), who shot from close range into the top of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) picks up a yellow card.
Substitution. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) on for Franck Ribery.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) will replace Jonas Hofmann.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Arjen Robben leaves the pitch and Toni Kroos (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Substitution. Mats Hummels is replaced by Manuel Friedrich (Dortmund).
Close! Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Substitution. Milos Jojic (Dortmund) in, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang out.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Toni Kroos (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision. A mid-range free kick is awarded to Bayern Munich out wide and from this angle a cross into the box is likely.

Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Roman Weidenfeller. The referee blows his whistle, Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.
Red card! Rafinha (Bayern Munich) is given a red card for his behaviour.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) has a great chance inside the box and fires the ball inside the left post.
A yellow card is awarded to Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart).
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.
Carlos Gruezo (VfB Stuttgart) is yellow-carded.
Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Florian Meyer had an easy-decision to make.

Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the right side of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance. The ball goes out of play and B. Monchengladbach have been awarded a corner kick.
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) goes on a mazy run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the target is thwarted by Marc-Andre ter Stegen.
Ibrahima Traore clips a neat ball into the box towards Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart), whose header from the centre of the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Florian Meyer has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Daniel Didavi will be replaced by Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart).
That will be all from Christoph Kramer who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch for Patrick Herrmann.
The game has come to an end for Timo Werner. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart).
Substitution. Amin Younes (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Havard Nordtveit.
Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart) unleashes a brilliant effort from the free kick, but the ball crashes against the bar. What a chance!

The ball hits the back of the net! Max Kruse showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Juan Arango (B. Monchengladbach) gets onto the scoresheet by sweetly heading it low into the middle of the net  1:1.
A substitution has been made. Martin Harnik goes off and Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Benjamin Kessel (Braunschweig), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Totally disorientated Damir Vranci (Braunschweig) scores a goal. Unfortunately it's an own goal.
Ermin Bicakcic (Braunschweig) has received a yellow card for his foul.

Christian Gunter (Freiburg) receives a precise pass inside the box and drills a promising first-time blast towards the middle of the goal. His effort is blocked by Daniel Davari who dives to keep the ball out. What a save!
Dominick Kumbela (Braunschweig) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Dennis Kruppke (Braunschweig) will take his place on the pitch.
Karim Guede (Freiburg) climbs highest in the box and sends a poor header miles over the crossbar. Very poor attempt. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) scores a cracking goal from long range. The goalkeeper was helpless and could do nothing with that shot.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) for a tough tackle.
Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Orhan Ademi (Braunschweig) for Damir Vrancic.
Dennis Kruppke (Braunschweig) decides to have a direct shot at goal from the free kick, but the ball hits the right post. It's a goal kick.
It should have been a goal! Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) fires a rocket of a shot but it only hits the crossbar! The play will be restarted with a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Karim Bellarabi (Braunschweig) comes onto the pitch for Benjamin Kessel.
Substitution. Sebastien Freis (Freiburg) replaces Karim Guede.
We are about to witness a substitution. Philipp Zulechner (Freiburg) is replacing Admir Mehmedi.
Karim Bellarabi (Braunschweig) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Today's referee Tobias Welz rightly decides to book Philipp Zulechner (Freiburg) for his harsh tackle.
Substitution. Felix Klaus will be replaced by Gelson Fernandes (Freiburg).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
What a chance for Lars Stindl (Hannover) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.
Lars Stindl (Hannover) heads the ball low inside the left post after a splendid cross. This timely header produces a wonderful moment.
Heiko Westermann has picked up an injury and is replaced by Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger).

Lars Stindl (Hannover) leaps to meet an excellent cross on the edge of the penalty box and sends in a fantastic header towards the bottom left corner of the goal. The opponents defence, however, masters the situation well and keeps the ball out.
Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
That will be all from Rafael van der Vaart who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Mattia Maggio (Hamburger).
Robert Hartmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) shows what an intelligent of a player he is after hitting a low shot from a free kick that goes under the defensive wall and into the bottom left corner!

Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Rene Adler gets down to his right to keep it out. The ball goes out of play and Hannover have been awarded a corner kick.
Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) receives a yellow card for infringement.
The manager makes a subsitution with Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover) coming on for Christian Pander.
Goal! Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 2:1.
We are about to witness a substitution. Ola John (Hamburger) is replacing Tolgay Arslan.
A substitution has been made. Leonardo Bittencourt goes off and Salif Sane (Hannover) comes on.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

This is really unlucky! Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) attempted to clear the ball away after the oppositions corner kick into the box, but he miskicked the clearance and placed it into his own net, specifically into the top right corner. He won't enjoy watching the highlights later.
Elkin Soto clips a neat ball into the box towards Shinji Okazaki (Mainz), whose header from the centre of the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) has too much to say to the referee and is cautioned.
Clinical finish! Christoph Moritz (Mainz) finds himself some space inside the box to control a rebound and fires the ball into the right side of the goal, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
A yellow card for a tackle by Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Shinji Okazaki (Mainz), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) sends in a shot from a promising distance after a precise pass. His effort goes inches over the crossbar.

Raphael Wolf doesn't have to worry about this one. Shinji Okazaki plays a pass into the feet of Yunus Malli (Mainz), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes well wide of the right post.
Zdenek Pospech feeds the ball through to Yunus Malli (Mainz), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly drills it into the roof of the net! The goalkeeper was helpless. 3:0!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle to start the second half.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Nils Petersen walks off the pitch to be replaced by Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen).
Close! Yunus Malli (Mainz) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only rattles the right post.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge. Mainz are given an advantage. They have a free kick.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though.
Substitution. Aaron Hunt makes way for Ludovic Obraniak (Werder Bremen).
Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save. The referee signals a corner kick to Werder Bremen.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) wins himself enough space to connect with a cross inside the box, but his fine header goes narrowly over the crossbar!
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Philipp Bargfrede departs the field of play to be replaced by Martin Kobylanski (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Elkin Soto is replaced by Benedikt Saller (Mainz).
It will be a substitution. Malik Fathi (Mainz) is ready to enter the pitch as Junior Diaz walks off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christoph Moritz leaves the pitch and Bo Svensson (Mainz) comes on.
Deniz Aytekin is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Raphael Schafer was forced into action to thwart Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball goes out of play. Wolfsburg are awarded a corner kick.
Markus Feulner (Nurnberg) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home inside the left post. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Kevin De Bruyne swings the cross over. Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar.
Kevin De Bruyne feeds the ball through to Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the left side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:1!
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne provides Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the right post. 2:1.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Mike Frantz limps off the pitch to be replaced by Jose Campana (Nurnberg).
Adam Hlousek (Nurnberg) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Hanno Balitsch (Nurnberg) jumps highest to meet an accurate cross and heads the ball towards the net. His fine header whistles just inches over the crossbar.
Substitution. Adam Hlousek walks off the pitch and Robert Mak (Nurnberg) comes on as a substitute.
Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post.

Maximilian Arnold passes to Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 3:1.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Nurnberg) is cautioned by the referee.
It's time for a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Maximilian Arnold.
Naldo (Wolfsburg) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the right post.
Substitution. Martin Angha is replaced by Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg).
It's a goal! Ivica Olic plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 4:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Luiz Gustavo departs the field of play to be replaced by Jan Polak (Wolfsburg).
The substitution has been made. Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) has replaced Ivan Perisic.
What a great touch by Vieirinha (Wolfsburg) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot towards the roof of the net, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.

A header by Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) from very close range goes towards the crossbar, but doesn't get past Kevin Trapp, who makes a brilliant save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Schalke will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Christian Dingert starts the second half.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post. A goal kick will follow.

Good touch by Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) as he latched on to an accurate pass before attempting to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range shot. Unluckily for him, his attempt only rattles the left post.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) sends a rebound goalwards, low to the left-hand post, but the goalkeeper stretches to stop it.
Max Meyer (Schalke) collects a rebound and hits it precisely into the middle of the goal.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) is penalised after knocking an opponent down. It's a penalty to Schalke! Let's see who's going to take it.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) doesn't take advantage of the chance to score from the penalty spot. He shoots to the bottom right corner, but Kevin Trapp leaps out to thwart his effort.
The game has come to an end for Tranquillo Barnetta. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jan Rosenthal (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Here's the change. Alexander Meier leaves the pitch and Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Max Meyer (Schalke) left the pitch, and Chinedu Obasi (Schalke) is coming on to help his team.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box, but the ball crashes against the crossbar! It would have been a superb goal.
It's time for a substitution. Felipe Santana (Schalke) comes on in place of Kevin-Prince Boateng.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Julian Draxler will be replaced by Jefferson Farfan (Schalke).

Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) finds himself free inside the box and pulls the trigger, but his effort is brilliantly stopped by one of the defending players. The ball is out of play. Schalke will take a throw-in.
Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) takes the free kick and beats the goalkeeper with a shot which goes inside the left post. Simply stunning!
The match has just finished.
Felix Brych checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Goal - 1:0! Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Per Skjelbred provided an assist for the goal.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) collected a pass and decided to shoot from about 18 metres out. He hit it perfectly! The ball zoomed around the goalkeeper and ended up in the bottom left corner.
What was John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Koen Casteels is alert and denies him with a nice save.
The end of the first half.
Referee Felix Brych blows his whistle to start the second half.

Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post. That will be a goal kick.
We are about to witness a substitution. Kai Herdling (Hoffenheim) is replacing Tarik Elyounoussi.
Substitution. Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) in, John Brooks out.
What a big chance! Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.
Koen Casteels (Hoffenheim) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Alexander Stolz (Hoffenheim) will take his place on the pitch.
That's the end of the game for Anis Ben-Hatira, who is replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Substitution. Sejad Salihovic makes way for Kenan Karaman (Hoffenheim).

Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) sends a direct shot in from the free kick that's in a promising position. The ball sails towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
That's it for today, Felix Brych has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Referee Peter Gagelmann blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Goal! Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:0.
Damir Vrancic (Braunschweig) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post. It's a goal kick.

Stunning strike! Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Braunschweig) latches on to a precise through ball from Benjamin Kessel before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 2:0.
Today's referee Peter Gagelmann rightly decides to book Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) for his harsh tackle.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
It's time for a substitution. Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) comes on in place of .
Andre Hoffmann (Hannover) makes a horror tackle on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
Omar Elabdellaoui (Braunschweig) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Braunschweig) gets the ball and drives a shot high over the bar from the edge of the area. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.
Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only rattles the right post.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Damir Vranci (Braunschweig) is leaving the pitch, and Norman Theuerkauf (Braunschweig) will replace him.
The booking goes to Christian Schulz (Hannover).
That's the end of the game for Leon Andreasen, who is replaced by Edgar Prib (Hannover).
Mirko Boland (Braunschweig) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Peter Gagelmann ignores the protests.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Karim Bellarabi (Braunschweig) comes onto the pitch so that Domi Kumbela can be given a rest.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Valmir Sulejmani (Hannover) for Leonardo Bittencourt.
It will be a substitution. Orhan Ademi (Braunschweig) is ready to enter the pitch as Havard Kallevik Nielsen walks off.
Goal! Karim Bellarabi provides Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 3:0.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Ivan Perisic slides a brilliant pass into Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker over the crossbar. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
Yellow card. Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg) is well placed to meet a cross and sends a difficult header low towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper reacts well to stop the effort.
Goal! Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 0:1.
What was Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

OFF THE BAR! Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Knut Kircher has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Substitution. Milos Jojic (Dortmund) in, Nuri Sahin out.
Here comes a substitution. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) has had enough and is replaced by Erik Durm (Dortmund).
Gooal! Marco Reus takes over corner duties. Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the right side of the net. 1:1.
Milos Jojic (Dortmund) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Christian Trasch is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Patrick Ochs (Wolfsburg).

Golden chance! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.
Substitution. Oliver Kirch (Dortmund) on for Henrikh Mkhitaryan.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) scores! He darts into the box and finds himself unmarked to drill a shot into the middle of the goal.
It's time for a substitution. Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Junior Malanda.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Excellent touch by Sascha Molders (Augsburg)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a terrific save.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Manuel Neuer is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Goal! Daniel Baier provides Sascha Molders (Augsburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the top right corner. 1:0.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Substitution. Xherdan Shaqiri makes way for Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich).
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post! None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ylli Sallahi departs the field of play to be replaced by David Alaba (Bayern Munich).
Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) zig-zags his way into the box and drills a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a superb stop.
Substitution. Ronny Philp (Augsburg) in, Raphael Holzhauser out.
Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier. Bayern Munich win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Substitution. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) on for Claudio Pizarro.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Augsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Good touch by David Alaba (Bayern Munich) as he latched on to an accurate pass before attempting to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range shot. Unluckily for him, his attempt only rattles the left post.
Jeong-Ho Hong goes off the pitch and Dominik Reinhardt (Augsburg) comes on.
Daniel van Buyten (Bayern Munich) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
That will be all from Sascha Molders who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg).
Mitchell Weiser (Bayern Munich) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. A free kick has been awarded to Bayern Munich.
What a chance that is! Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the right post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt). Wolfgang Stark doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Niki Zimling (Mainz) releases a powerful first-time effort from the edge of the box which goes in the direction of the bottom left corner of the target, but the keeper leaps like a salmon to deny him. Excellent goalkeeping! Now Mainz have a corner.
Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) rises above the defence and heads a precise cross towards the left post. His effort, however, is blocked by Loris Karius, who pulls off a stunning save!
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Niki Zimling (Mainz) for a tough tackle. Eintracht Frankfurt win a free kick.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header just wide of the left post!
It's a yellow card for Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Johannes Geis (Mainz) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box, but it's blocked by the players standing in the wall, saving the goalkeeper a lot of effort. The ball is out of play. Mainz win a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) plants a goal-bound header towards the middle of the target after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders manages to deflect it away. It will be a corner kick for Mainz.
Wolfgang Stark shows the yellow card to Zdenek Pospech (Mainz) for a heavy challenge. Eintracht Frankfurt win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Tranquillo Barnetta (Eintracht Frankfurt) unleashes a brilliant effort from the free kick, but the ball crashes against the bar. What a chance!

Sebastian Jung shows his great technique and produces a beautiful cross into the box. Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets on the scoresheet by heading the ball precisely inside the right post. It's now 0:0.
Christoph Moritz (Mainz) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Wolfgang Stark didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
The foul by Stefan Bell (Mainz) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Wolfgang Stark.
That will be all from Niki Zimling who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Shawn Parker (Mainz).
Johannes Flum has picked up an injury and is replaced by Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Yunus Malli (Mainz) replacing Shinji Okazaki (Mainz).
A substitution has been made. Christoph Moritz is replaced by Sebastian Polter (Mainz).

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 2:0.
The substitution has been made. Stefano Celozzi (Eintracht Frankfurt) has replaced Constant Djakpa.

Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the roof of the net, but Loris Karius is prepared and leaps to thwart him. The referee points to the corner flag and Eintracht Frankfurt will take a corner.
The referee signals a substitution. Stephan Schrock (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Tranquillo Barnetta.
Johannes Geis (Mainz) unleashed a brilliant free kick from the edge of the box and hits the left post of the goal.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.

Raphael Schafer pulls off a great save to deny Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal. B. Monchengladbach win a corner.

Javier Pinola (Nurnberg) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. B. Monchengladbach earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Juan Arango (B. Monchengladbach) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the back of the net.

Crossbar! Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from around the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball crashed against the bar!
It must be a yellow card. It is. Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) receives the caution after an awful tackle. Nurnberg win a free kick.
What a great touch by Juan Arango (B. Monchengladbach) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads towards the left side of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him.
Here's the change. Martin Angha leaves the pitch and Robert Mak (Nurnberg) comes on as a substitute.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a yellow card. It's a free kick to Nurnberg, but they probably won't attempt a direct shot on goal from here.
Here comes a substitution. Lukas Rupp (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Patrick Herrmann.

Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) starts an individual run, not looking to pass to a teammate, and easily weaves through the defence to get deep inside the box. He shoots low, but misses the goal by a whisker!
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
The manager makes a subsitution with Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg) coming on for Berkay Dabanli.
Today's match ends for Raffael who will be replaced by Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach).
Tobias Stieler blows the whistle, Mike Frantz (Nurnberg) is penalised for a foul. That's a penalty to B. Monchengladbach! They have a good chance to score now.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) takes the penalty and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom the right corner!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jose Campana (Nurnberg) replaces Josip Drmic.
That's the end of the game for Max Kruse, who is replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Hiroshi Kiyotake (Nurnberg) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity!

Excellent touch by Hiroshi Kiyotake (Nurnberg)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
