Today's referee Felix Zwayer rightly decides to book Oliver Sorg (Freiburg) for his harsh tackle.

A great job from two opposing players there. Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) fired a shot nicely in on goal from distance towards the roof of the net, while Oliver Baumann produced a wonderful piece of goalkeeping to parry the ball onto the bar.

Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart) attempts to send a defence-splitting pass in order to find free space for his teammate. Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
Carlos Gruezo (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Substitution. Vedad Ibisevic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
Substitution. Totally exhausted Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) is leaving the pitch, and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) will replace him.
Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) finds some space deep inside the box to fire a volley into the back of the net, leaving the keeper helpless. A stunning goal!
Here comes a substitution. Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) is brought on as a substitute for Karim Guede.

Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart) releases Timo Werner, who latched on to his perfect through pass and can continue with his team's attack. OFF THE CROSSBAR! Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) will replace Carlos Gruezo.

Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart) takes the ball and sets it for the free kick. Antonio Rudiger (VfB Stuttgart) pounces on the rebound inside the penalty box and tries to prod home! Unluckily for his team, the ball crashes against the crossbar!

It's a goal! Alexandru Maxim delivers a teasing cross from the resulting corner and the ball falls into the space where Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) is lurking. His close-range shot goes into the net and it's 2:0.
Substitution. Felix Klaus has come on for Maximilian Philipp (Freiburg).
Yellow card. Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Ambitious effort from Aaron Hunt (Werder Bremen). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well wide of the right post.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!

OFF THE POST! Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) latched on to a good low pass and attempted to surprise the goalkeeper with a snap shot. His effort sailed way wide of the right post, however.
What a wasted chance that was! An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) who loops his header high over the bar.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) gets to the ball after a big mistake by the defending player and scores with a precise shot into the left side of the goal.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) gets on the end of a pass and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's blocked by one of the defending players. The ball is out of play. Schalke will have a chance to score from a corner.
Kaan Ayhan (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) picks up a pass, lines up a shot and strikes from 20 metres out, but Raphael Wolf thwarts the effort which is headed to the bottom left corner.
Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) makes a yard for himself and attempts to endanger the goalkeeper with a long-range shot. His great effort, however, goes a whisker wide of the left post.
We are about to witness a substitution. Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) is replacing Franco Di Santo.
Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes just a few inches over the bar! What a huge opportunity!

Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. Werder Bremen get a corner.
Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) unleashes a shot from 19 metres out but is unable to find the target and it goes well wide of the left post.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke will be replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).
Tim Hoogland (Schalke) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Eljero Elia will be replaced by Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen).

Chance! Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and smashes the ball towards the top right corner, but Ralf Fahrmann is alert and makes a great save to deny him. The ball goes behind for a corner. Werder Bremen will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) picks up a pass, lines up a shot and strikes from 20 metres out, but Ralf Fahrmann thwarts the effort which is headed to the bottom right corner.
It's time for a substitution. Adam Szalai (Schalke) comes on in place of Klaas-Jan Huntelaar.
Substitution. Ludovic Obraniak (Werder Bremen) replaces Clemens Fritz.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) receives a quality pass, makes a yard for himself and smashes a jaw-dropping long-range shot into the bottom left corner. What a remarkable goal!

Michael Ian Mancienne (Hamburger) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence. A short break for the players as the play will restart with a goal kick.
Milan Badelj is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Tomas Rincon (Hamburger).
What a save from Rene Adler! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Bernd Leno stops the ball from going into the top of the net. The ball goes out of play. Hamburger SV are awarded a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 20 metres out. Bernd Leno stops the effort which is headed to the roof of the net. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hamburger SV will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) decides to test the goalkeeper with a long-range effort and scores! The goalkeeper underestimated the shot which ended up in the middle of the net. He should have done better.
The substitution is prepared. Robert Tesche (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Rafael van der Vaart.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) covers his face with his hands after spurning a great chance. The ball rebounded to him but his close-range header went a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes to play from a goal kick.

What a sweet touch by Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Rene Adler to hold. Bayer Leverkusen have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Mattia Maggio (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch after Jacques Zoua signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Lars Bender.
Goal! Dennis Diekmeier puts a cross into the box and finds Heiko Westermann (Hamburger), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the top left corner. He makes it 2:1.
Tomas Rincon (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Bastian Dankert ignores the protests.
A substitution has been made. Giulio Donati goes off and Levin Oztunali (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
The manager has decided to substitute Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) and he has been replaced by Seung-Woo Ryu (Bayer Leverkusen).
Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Referee Markus Schmidt blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

A neat pass is well received by Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the left post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot. The ball goes out for a corner. Werder Bremen can continue in their attacking effort.
Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) fails to turn the rebound in as the goalkeeper pulls off a great save to keep him out. Good work from Werder Bremen as they win a corner.
Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) proves that he is an excellent free-kick taker after finding the back of the net with a clever shot that goes straight into the bottom right corner!
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal! Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and fires the ball past the goalkeeper.
Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Substitution. Salif Sane walks off the pitch and Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) comes on as a substitute.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen), whose header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Here's the change.  leaves the pitch and Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) comes on as a substitute.
Leon Andreasen (Hannover) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save. The ball goes out of play. Hannover are awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Eljero Elia did his best and is replaced by Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen).
The referee has issued a yellow card to Lars Stindl (Hannover).
Substitution. Aaron Hunt makes way for Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen).

Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen) outjumps the defenders inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a header into the middle of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 1:2.
Substitution. Valmir Sulejmani has come on for Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Cedric Makiadi.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Referee Thorsten Kinhofer blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

It's in the back of the net! Hakan Calhanoglu sends a cross in from the set piece and Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes inside the left post and the score changes to 0:1.
The referee blows his whistle, a clear handball by Michael Ian Mancienne (Hamburger). The advantage of a penalty kick is given to B. Monchengladbach.
Filip Daems (B. Monchengladbach) takes a risk and fires the penalty straight down the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper is alert and makes a save with his legs!
Goal! The rebound fell to Filip Daems (B. Monchengladbach) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:1.
Juan Arango (B. Monchengladbach) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Substitution. Pierre-Michel Lasogga walks off the pitch and Ola John (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
The whistle blows and Thorsten Kinhofer starts the second half.
Tomas Rincon sprays a pass out to Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes high over the bar.
Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch because Martin Stranzl simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Michael Ian Mancienne (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Thorsten Kinhofer ignores the protests.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home inside the right post. The goalkeeper was helpless.

Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) scores from the resulting corner. The ball slips through the box to Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) and he smashes it into the top left corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Here's the change. Tolgay Arslan leaves the pitch and Robert Tesche (Hamburger) comes on as a substitute.
The substitution is prepared. Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Dennis Diekmeier.
CHANCE! Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.

Marc-Andre ter Stegen pulls off a great save to deny Jacques Zoua (Hamburger), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Hamburger SV.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Patrick Herrmann walks off the pitch to be replaced by Lukas Rupp (B. Monchengladbach).
Lukas Rupp (B. Monchengladbach) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just over the crossbar.
Substitution. Raffael is replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Hiroshi Kiyotake produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Emanuel Pogatetz (Nurnberg) rises high to head the ball into the left side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 0:1.
Emanuel Pogatetz (Nurnberg) is shown a yellow card by the referee.

The foul by Niklas Stark (Nurnberg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jochen Drees. Freiburg are awarded a free kick from mid-range. The position is unsuitable for a direct shot, so expect a cross into the box.
OFF THE POST! Good play from Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes the left post!
Jose Campana (Nurnberg) fails to control his temper and is booked by the referee for dissent.
Jonathan Schmid takes over corner duties and expertly finds Pavel Krmas (Freiburg), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the left side of the goal. The score is now 1:1.
Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) creates a good chance for himself and fires in a powerful close-range shot, but his effort ricochets off the left post.
is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Jochen Drees ignores the protests.
Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Nurnberg.
Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) steps up to take the penalty and brilliantly fires the ball into the top left corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Niklas Stark comes off the pitch to be replaced by Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg).

The game is interrupted. Emanuel Pogatetz (Nurnberg) has violated the rules in the battle for the ball. No protests or gestures are being made as he is quite aware of what he did. It's a penalty! What an opportunity to score for Freiburg.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) coolly converts the penalty. His precise shot goes inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Goal! Felix Klaus (Freiburg) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home into the top left corner.

Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom left corner, but Raphael Schafer was alert and the score remains the same.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg) will replace Mike Frantz.
Ondrej Petrak just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Javier Pinola (Nurnberg) replaces him.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) sees a yellow card from Jochen Drees after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Karim Guede (Freiburg) left the pitch, and Gelson Fernandes (Freiburg) is coming on to help his team.
Substitution. Philipp Zulechner (Freiburg) has come on for Admir Mehmedi.
Substitution. Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) replaces Jonathan Schmid.
Emanuel Pogatetz (Nurnberg) won't hear the final whistle in today's game as he is sent off following a second caution and must leave the pitch.
That's the end of the match.
Guido Winkmann checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
A sweet cross finds Ken Reichel (Braunschweig), who rips a stonking shot into the top left corner. Again, he showed his dazzling finishing ability from inside the box.
Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) is lucky to receive a yellow card from the referee because he could easily have been given a red card for his foul.

A player from Braunschweig commits a rough challenge. Guido Winkmann blows for a foul and keeps the game under control. The referee gives a penalty to Bayer Leverkusen after a quick talk with the linesman, who had apparently seen the situation from a better perspective.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) smartly converts the penalty. He strikes the ball into the middle of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Damir Vrancic leaves the pitch to be replaced by Kevin Kratz (Braunschweig).
Here's the change. Gonzalo Castro leaves the pitch and Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
Yellow card. Kevin Kratz (Braunschweig) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
A substitution has been made. Heung-Min Son is replaced by Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Omar Elabdellaoui is replaced by Norman Theuerkauf (Braunschweig).
Domi Kumbela goes off the pitch and Dennis Kruppke (Braunschweig) comes on.
Here comes a substitution. Emre Can is given a rest as he is replaced by Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen).
Mirko Boland (Braunschweig) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the bottom right corner, but is thwarted by a great save from Bernd Leno.
A yellow card for bad language! Andres Guardado (Bayer Leverkusen) couldnt remain silent and the result is obvious.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) is in the right place at the right time. He picks up the rebound after the goalkeeper's poor save and scores easily!
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Thiago Alcantara as he is replaced by Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich).
Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Jens Grahl makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom left corner.

Xherdan Shaqiri sends a superb cross into the box. Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Jens Grahl beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Substitution. Anthony Modeste makes way for Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim).
It's a goal! Claudio Pizarro plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:1.
Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
Goal - 3:1! Franck Ribery laid the ball off to Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich), who shot from close range into the top left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) stands over the free kick from 22 out and sends a wonderful curling shot that goes into the top left corner. What a goal that is!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Christian Dingert has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Mario Gotze walks off the pitch to be replaced by Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich).
Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent. Bayern Munich win a free kick.
Sejad Salihovic has picked up an injury and is replaced by Kai Herdling (Hoffenheim).

Brilliant finish! Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Kai Herdling, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 3:3.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) is booked by the referee.
A substitution has been made. Franck Ribery is replaced by Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich).
Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) tries to convince the referee to change his mind and receives a yellow card for dissent.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Jens Grahl is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. The ball is out of play. Bayern Munich will have a chance to score from a corner.
CHANCE! Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.
Here comes a substitution. Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) has had enough and is replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hoffenheim).

What a sweet touch by Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) as he collects a pass. From near the edge of the box he produces a shot which goes towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a decent save to thwart him!
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Niko Bungert (Mainz) wins himself some space inside the box after the corner kick and finishes with a shot which goes inside the left post.
Substitution. Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) in, Ragnar Klavan out.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Tobias Werner leaves the pitch to be replaced by Alexander Esswein (Augsburg).
What an unlucky own goal by Marwin Hitz (Augsburg)!

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) accepts a pass deep inside the box and after a nice touch sends the ball towards the right side of the goal. It is a pretty sweet shot, but one of the defenders changes the trajectory of the ball and deflects it onto the post. What an unlucky moment for Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz). He must have smashed a mirror recently.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the right post. Marwin Hitz is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Nicolai Muller (Mainz) is given a yellow card.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) is cautioned by the referee.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) is booked by the referee.
Raul Bobadilla (Augsburg) executes a nice mid-range free kick. His effort only flies inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day.
It's time for a substitution. Sascha Molders (Augsburg) comes on in place of Paul Verhaegh.
Substitution. Yunus Malli (Mainz) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Nicolai Muller walks off.
Johannes Geis (Mainz) fires in a first-time projectile from about 25 metres. Marwin Hitz stretches but the ball is out of his reach and ends up inside the left post.
Substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo will be replaced by Niki Zimling (Mainz).
It is time for a substitution. Elkin Soto (Mainz) is on for Christoph Moritz.
Marco Fritz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) scores a goal! He makes his way to the edge of the box without any help from his teammates and unleashes a shot that ends inside the right post.
Goal! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Ibrahima Traore. The score is 2:0.

Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the left post. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. What a clinical finish!

Sven Ulreich was forced into action to thwart Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper. The referee blows his whistle, Dortmund are awarded a corner kick.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Oliver Kirch (Dortmund) receives a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

OFF THE POST! Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Substitution. Daniel Didavi makes his way off the pitch and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as his replacement.
Substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan is replaced by Nuri Sahin (Dortmund).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Oliver Kirch trots off the pitch and is replaced by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund).
Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) has received a yellow card for his foul.
We have witnessed a red card for Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart). PENALTY! One of the players from Dortmund is about to take a penalty kick.
Goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom left corner.
A substitution has been made. Ibrahima Traore goes off and Gotoku Sakai (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Substitution. Jonas Hofmann makes way for Milos Jojic (Dortmund).

Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails a few inches over the bar! The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang passes to Marco Reus (Dortmund), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes inside the right post. Fabulous goal! The score is 2:3.

Ambitious effort from Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well wide of the right post. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Martin Harnik.
Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Weiner ignores the protests.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds some space just outside the penalty area after getting on the end of a sweet pass and blasts the ball into the goal!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Timm Klose cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge. That's a free kick to Eintracht Frankfurt.
Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
That will be all from Junior Malanda who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
Jan Rosenthal (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch after Stephan Schrock signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
What was Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne puts a cross into the box and finds Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the left post. He makes it 1:1.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee signals a substitution. Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Martin Lanig.
Ivan Perisic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Patrick Ochs (Wolfsburg).
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) tries to convince the referee to change his mind and receives a yellow card for dissent.
Jan Rosenthal (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card for infringement.
A substitution has been made. Tranquillo Barnetta is replaced by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).
A wonderful pass found its target. Naldo (Wolfsburg) received it well and shot from about 35 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and into the top left corner.
Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets an accurate cross in the box and steers a fine header towards the net. The goalkeeper has to react quickly to keep the ball out. Eintracht Frankfurt have a corner.
Peter Gagelmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
What a magnificent shot by Kaan Ayhan (Schalke). Unfortunately for him, his free kick effort rattles the right post.
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.
Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Rune Jarstein with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:0.
Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release a low effort which ends up in the bottom right corner.
Substitution. Ronny (Hertha Berlin) has come on for Per Skjelbred.
The referee signals a substitution. Alexander Baumjohann (Hertha Berlin) is brought on as a substitute for Sandro Wagner.
Roman Neustadter (Schalke) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Max Meyer will be replaced by Adam Szalai (Schalke).
The manager has decided to substitute Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) and he has been replaced by Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin).
Today's match ends for Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke who will be replaced by Anthony Annan (Schalke).
Substitution. Julian Draxler makes way for Philipp Max (Schalke).
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike wasn't accurate at all and the ball went well over the bar.
Gunter Perl is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) finds himself some space inside the box, lines up the ball and unleashes a shot which goes into the bottom left corner.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but powers his header just wide of the left post.

Ronny Philp (Augsburg) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it. Augsburg will take a corner kick.
Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Thorsten Kinhofer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Thorsten Kinhofer starts the second half.
Great ball in from Giulio Donati. Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post.

Tobias Werner (Augsburg) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the left side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Bernd Leno (Bayer Leverkusen), who makes a comfortable save. Augsburg get a chance to score from a corner kick.
Ronny Philp produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Tobias Werner (Augsburg) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:1.
Here comes a substitution. Ronny Philp is given a rest as he is replaced by Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg).
What a big chance! Tobias Werner (Augsburg) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post. That will be a goal kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming onto the pitch as Gonzalo Castro cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Arkadiusz Milik (Augsburg) will replace Raul Bobadilla.
The game is interrupted. Daniel Baier (Augsburg) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Andres Guardado (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Thorsten Kinhofer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Goal! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.

Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) displayed brilliant individual skill before blasting in a shot from inside the box. His terrific effort went straight into the bottom right corner, via a ricochet in off the post. Marwin Hitz had no chance. The score sheet now reads 1:1.
Substitution. Heung-Min Son walks off the pitch and Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Kevin Vogt (Augsburg) left the pitch, and Sascha Molders (Augsburg) is coming on to help his team.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Andres Guardado walks off the pitch to be replaced by Philipp Wollscheid (Bayer Leverkusen).
Booking. Andre Hahn (Augsburg) receives a caution from the referee.
Thorsten Kinhofer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Goal - 1:0! Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the middle of the net. Martin Lanig provided an assist for the goal.

The Eintracht Frankfurt players are displaying brilliant short passes and great ball movement. They are waiting to open the opposition's defence and hit them swiftly on the break. Tranquillo Barnetta slides a brilliant pass into Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Manuel Grafe has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Filip Daems (B. Monchengladbach) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Patrick Herrmann will be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) sees a yellow card from Manuel Grafe after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Juan Arango (B. Monchengladbach) shoots at goal from the free kick from some 22 metres out. His attempt was quite precise and another few inches and it would have ended up inside the left post. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.

Tranquillo Barnetta (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes over to take the corner kick and it looks like he will swing the ball into the penalty box. Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt) reacted quickly inside the box and got on the end of the resulting corner. He drilled a low shot towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulled off an astonishing save to deny him.
It is time for a substitution. Amin Younes (B. Monchengladbach) is on for Juan Arango.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Lukas Rupp (B. Monchengladbach) for Julian Korb.
The referee signals a substitution. Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Stefan Aigner.
Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Tranquillo Barnetta walks off the pitch to be replaced by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Constant Djakpa is replaced by Stefano Celozzi (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the left post only for Oliver Baumann to dive and make a save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hamburger SV will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Mensur Mujdza is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Christian Gunter (Freiburg).

Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) shows good awareness deep inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and flies inches wide of the right-hand post.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
Great chance! Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Deniz Aytekin starts the second half.
Felix Klaus (Freiburg) blows a big chance! He quickly whipped the ball from inside the box towards the net to beat the keeper, but his effort crashes against the left post.
After a goalmouth scramble the ball rebounds out to Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) who buries it from close range straight into the bottom left corner.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Felix Klaus (Freiburg) gets booked.
Goal! Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the right post. It's 1:1.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Robert Tesche (Hamburger) replacing Petr Jiracek (Hamburger).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Gelson Fernandes as he is replaced by Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg).
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Milan Badelj (Hamburger).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Admir Mehmedi walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg).
The match has just finished.
Referee Peter Sippel blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

Lars Stindl produces a sweet pass and picks out Leon Andreasen (Hannover) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 0:1!

Goal! Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Ron-Robert Zieler is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 1:1.

A cross arrives in the goalmouth from the resulting corner kick. Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the bar! A short break for the players as the play will restart with a goal kick.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the left post! A goal kick will follow.
Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Peter Sippel ignores the protests. A free kick to Hoffenheim.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Roberto Firmino, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:1.
What a big chance! Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
It's time for a substitution. Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) comes on in place of Leonardo Bittencourt.
Here comes a substitution. Sejad Salihovic is given a rest as he is replaced by Kai Herdling (Hoffenheim).
Manuel Schmiedebach (Hannover) is sent off by the referee for a disgraceful tackle that simply has no place in football!
The referee signals a substitution. Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for .
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Edgar Prib (Hannover) is coming onto the pitch as Sebastien Pocognoli cannot continue after picking up an injury.
It is time for a substitution. Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) is on for Anthony Modeste.
That will be all from Kevin Volland who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim).
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) collected a pass and decided to shoot from about 30 metres out. He hit it perfectly! The ball zoomed around the goalkeeper and ended up in the middle of the goal.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Konstantin Rausch (VfB Stuttgart) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity!

Mike Frantz (Nurnberg) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.

Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Sven Ulreich is alert and denies him. The ball is out of play. Nurnberg win a corner kick.
Goal - 1:0! Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Hiroshi Kiyotake provided an assist for the goal.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.
The referee signals a substitution. Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Martin Harnik.
It is time for a substitution. Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) is on for Konstantin Rausch.
Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart) latched on to a fine crossfield pass on the edge of the box and lashed a shot straight at the goalkeeper, who made an easy save.
Goal! Markus Feulner puts a cross into the box and finds Josip Drmic (Nurnberg), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the right post. He makes it 2:0.
Gotoku Sakai (VfB Stuttgart) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Gotoku Sakai departs the field of play to be replaced by Carlos Gruezo (VfB Stuttgart).
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Hanno Balitsch (Nurnberg) replacing Jose Campana (Nurnberg).

Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Raphael Schafer guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
That's the end of the game for Markus Feulner, who is replaced by Robert Mak (Nurnberg).
Niklas Stark (Nurnberg) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Substitution. Josip Drmic is replaced by Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg).
Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) connects with the ball in the six-yard box after the resulting free kick and shoots towards goal, but Raphael Schafer makes a magnificent save!
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) finds some space inside the box and scores with a terrific header into the top left corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Goal! Zdenek Pospech puts a cross into the box and finds Nicolai Muller (Mainz), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the left post. He makes it 1:1.
Mirko Boland (Braunschweig) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
A substitution has been made. Marcel Correia goes off and Deniz Dogan (Braunschweig) comes on.
Nicolai Muller (Mainz) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it to the middle of the goal, but Daniel Davari makes a comfortable save to stop his effort.
After a goalmouth scramble the ball rebounds out to Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Braunschweig) who buries it from close range straight into the bottom right corner.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) commits a rough foul. Robert Hartmann stops the game and makes a call.
Yunus Malli (Mainz) commits an ugly tackle on his opponent, but there is no caution from the referee. Braunschweig are awarded the free kick.
Good chance for Damir Vrancic (Braunschweig) as he latched on to a cross on the edge of the box and blasted the ball towards the net! It flew wide of the right post.
The game has come to an end for Maxim Choupo-Moting. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Sebastian Polter (Mainz).
Substitution. Julian Koch makes his way off the pitch and Todor Nedelev (Mainz) comes on as his replacement.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Daniel Davari, who pulls off a decent save!
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Domi Kumbela comes off the pitch to be replaced by Orhan Ademi (Braunschweig).
Here comes a substitution. Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Braunschweig) has had enough and is replaced by Marco Caligiuri (Braunschweig).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Referee Florian Meyer blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Florian Meyer shows the yellow card to Marco Reus (Dortmund) for a heavy challenge.
Julian Draxler (Schalke) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) collects a pass and has an effort from distance to the bottom left corner, but Ralf Fahrmann answers with a superb save to deny him. It will be a corner kick for Dortmund.

Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick. Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Ralf Fahrmann.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) unleashes a superb first-time shot from the edge of the box, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Mats Hummels (Dortmund) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.

Roman Neustadter (Schalke) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Roman Weidenfeller pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) finds the space inside the box to meet a cross, but his effort from near the penalty spot towards the right post is saved by the goalkeeper.

A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick. Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
A yellow card for a tackle by Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke). Florian Meyer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The game has come to an end for Max Meyer. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Anthony Annan (Schalke).
Substitution. Henrikh Mkhitaryan is replaced by Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund).
Leon Goretzka comes off the pitch to be replaced by Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Julian Schieber (Dortmund) will replace Kevin Grosskreutz.
Substitution. Julian Draxler leaves the pitch and is replaced by Philipp Max (Schalke).
That's it for today, Florian Meyer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Referee Marco Fritz blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
After a goalmouth scramble the ball rebounds out to Toni Kroos (Bayern Munich) who buries it from close range into the left side of the goal.

Bastian Schweinsteiger shows his great technique and produces a beautiful cross into the box. Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) gets on the scoresheet by heading the ball precisely inside the right post. It's now 0:1.
What a chance that is! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header crashes off the crossbar!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the right post. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
The end of the first half.
Referee Marco Fritz blows his whistle to start the second half.
Today's match ends for Thomas Muller who will be replaced by Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich).
Here comes a substitution. Tired Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) left the pitch, and Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is coming on to help his team.
Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) connects with a pin-point cross but blazes the ball high over the bar. His shot wasn't accurate, nor powerful enough. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
The manager has decided to substitute Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) and he has been replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin) on for Levan Kobiashvili.
Clear holding by Rafinha (Bayern Munich). The referee made a good decision and a free kick for a foul is given. Penalty! A huge opportunity to score for Hertha Berlin.
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) steps up to take the penalty and converts it with a shot into the middle of the goal.
The foul by Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz.
Hany Mukhtar will be replaced by Ronny (Hertha Berlin).
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) goes for goal but he blazes his shot well over the top. That will be a goal kick.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) scores a goal! He latches onto a lovely pass that puts him one-on-one with the keeper before producing a fine strike that goes into the left side of the net!

Rafinha (Bayern Munich) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Thomas Kraft to get hold of the ball.
Substitution. Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Adrian Ramos walks off.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Daniel Siebert checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg) rose high above the defence to head the ball over the goalkeeper and inside the net.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) latches on to a killer pass deep inside the box and coolly puts the ball inside the right post!
The ball is whipped in from the resulting set piece and finds Sebastian Prodl (Werder Bremen), who rises and produces a crashing header into the middle of the net.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
What a chance for Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.
Substitution. Felix Kroos leaves the pitch and is replaced by Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen).
Daniel Siebert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Diego Benaglio makes way for Max Grun (Wolfsburg).
The manager has decided to substitute Ludovic Obraniak (Werder Bremen) and he has been replaced by Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen).
CHANCE! Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.

Excellent touch by Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes all the way into the top left corner. He makes it 1:2 with this magnificent strike.
Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen) goes into the book for bad language. His vulgar comments could have made it worse. Luckily for him, it's a yellow card.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.
That's the end of the game for Maximilian Arnold, who is replaced by Jan Polak (Wolfsburg).
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
The manager makes a subsitution with Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) coming on for Ivan Perisic.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) will replace Nils Petersen.
Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) clearly handles the ball, but he is surprised when the referee blows his whistle. A penalty is awarded to Hoffenheim!
Booking. Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a caution from the referee.
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) converts the penalty with ease, Antonin Panenka style.
Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.

The ball hits the back of the net! Emir Spahic showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) manages to convert it into a sweet goal. He heads it inside the right post and gets on the scoresheet  1:1.

Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) scores with a great individual effort! He makes a good run, skips past defenders and fires the ball from the edge of the box past the diving goalkeeper. The shot went into the top left corner. Absolutely phenomenal!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Jochen Drees blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Lars Bender, then sends the ball into the roof of the net. 2:2.
The manager has decided to substitute Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) and he has been replaced by Kai Herdling (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Heung-Min Son makes way for Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen).
The game has come to an end for Sidney Sam. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kevin Volland departs the field of play to be replaced by Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim).
The yellow card is received by Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim).
Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the left-hand post.
It's in the back of the net! Fabian Johnson plays it into the box, and Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the bottom left corner. 2:3.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Anthony Modeste trots off the pitch and is replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hoffenheim).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Knut Kircher checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Golden chance! Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
Goal! Tranquillo Barnetta (Eintracht Frankfurt) scores after an assist by Stefan Aigner that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:1.
Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Hanno Balitsch (Nurnberg) will take his place on the pitch.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Raphael Schafer dived superbly to block a header by Tranquillo Barnetta (Eintracht Frankfurt) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the left post, but Raphael Schafer pulled off a remarkable save!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Knut Kircher has ended it.
Substitution. Hiroshi Kiyotake will be replaced by Robert Mak (Nurnberg).
The whistle blows and Knut Kircher starts the second half.
Goal! Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 0:2. He was ably assisted there by Stefan Aigner.

Martin Lanig (Eintracht Frankfurt) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Raphael Schafer pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Goal! Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top left corner. It's 0:3.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Emanuel Pogatetz (Nurnberg) is leaving the pitch, and Niklas Stark (Nurnberg) will replace him.
Simply glorious! Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) wonderfully times his run onto a cross and thunders the ball from deep inside the box into the top right corner!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Constant Djakpa.
Jose Campana (Nurnberg) latches on to a pass and controls it with a good first touch. He unleashes a deadly strike from around 25 metres out which goes into the bottom left corner.
We are about to witness a substitution. Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) is replacing Stefan Aigner.

We have witnessed a sending off. Javier Pinola (Nurnberg) is shown a red card and it's an early bath for him I guess. Eintracht Frankfurt get the opportunity to endanger the opposition's goal with a free kick from the edge of the box.
Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes the free kick from the edge of the box, but the goalkeeper perfectly sets up the defensive wall and his effort is thwarted.
Goal! Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:4.
Substitution. Martin Lanig is replaced by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Raphael Schafer is just a bystander as the ball flies into the top right corner. The score is 2:5.
Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Peter Gagelmann checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
What a big chance! Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Goal! Patrick Herrmann slips it to Juan Arango (B. Monchengladbach) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom right corner with a great effort. The score is 1:0.
The ball is whipped in from the resulting set piece and finds Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach), who rises and produces a crashing header low into the middle of the net.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and sends a low drive past the goalkeeper.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Martin Stranzl (B. Monchengladbach) rises high to connect with a cross from the corner kick, but his powerful header from center of the box hits the left post!
The foul by Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Peter Gagelmann.
Christoph Kramer comes off the pitch to be replaced by Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Christoph Janker (Hertha Berlin) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Hajime Hosogai walks off.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Patrick Herrmann will be replaced by Amin Younes (B. Monchengladbach).
The manager makes a subsitution with Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) coming on for Adrian Ramos.
The manager has decided to substitute Juan Arango (B. Moenchengladbach) and he has been replaced by Lukas Rupp (B. Moenchengladbach).
That's it for today, Peter Gagelmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Andre Hoffmann (Hannover) fails to score from inside the box as his rebound smashes against the right post!
This is a yellow card! Hiroki Sakai (Hannover) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
It's in the back of the net! Sokratis picks out Mats Hummels (Dortmund) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 0:1.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) dribbles into the box and fires the ball inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance. Sensational solo goal.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Salif Sane trots off the pitch and is replaced by Didier Ya Konan (Hannover).
Substitution. Nuri Sahin will be replaced by Sebastian Kehl (Dortmund).
Here's the change. Jonas Hofmann leaves the pitch and Marco Reus (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
The game has come to an end for Edgar Prib. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover).
Mats Hummels (Dortmund) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Substitution. Julian Schieber (Dortmund) in, Robert Lewandowski out.
Roman Weidenfeller pulls off a great save to deny Lars Stindl (Hannover), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) picks up the ball inside the penalty box and immediately fires a first-time effort that sails well over the crossbar and ends in the stands. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
That was a piece of magic. Marco Reus (Dortmund) picks the ball up at the edge of the box and scores a screamer. The ball went in close to the left post, leaving the goalkeeper no chance.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

What a wasted opportunity by Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom right corner, but Loris Karius makes an astonishing save to thwart him. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Bayern Munich.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
Nicolai Muller (Mainz) zig-zags his way into the box and fires the ball towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great reaction save to stop the effort.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo will be replaced by Benedikt Saller (Mainz).
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) smashes the ball against the crossbar! What a chance.

Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence. The ball goes to play from a goal kick.

Loris Karius makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the top right corner by Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) after a cross from the side. The referee blows his whistle, Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes inches wide of the left post. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.
Maxim Choupo-Moting will be replaced by Niko Bungert (Mainz).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Thomas Muller departs the field of play to be replaced by Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich).

Nice individual effort by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom right corner, but Loris Karius does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
Here's the change. Arjen Robben leaves the pitch and Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) replaces Mario Mandzukic.

GOAL! Xherdan Shaqiri produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) rises high to head the ball into the bottom right corner and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 0:1.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Christoph Moritz (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
Christoph Moritz comes off the pitch to be replaced by Yunus Malli (Mainz).
Goal! Franck Ribery feeds Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 0:2.
That's the end of the match.
Wolfgang Stark checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.

What a beautiful moment! Leon Goretzka (Schalke) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way inside the left post. Daniel Davari just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:0.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Daniel Davari, who pulls off a decent save!
Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) makes a foul and receives a yellow card. He is not happy with the referee's decision. A free kick to Braunschweig.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Karim Bellarabi (Braunschweig) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Marc Pfitzner makes way for Orhan Ademi (Braunschweig).
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Karim Bellarabi leaves the pitch and is replaced by Omar Elabdellaoui (Braunschweig).

What a great chance for Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the right post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) takes the free kick and sends it towards the bottom right corner of the goal, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) replaces Max Meyer.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Domi Kumbela trots off the pitch and is replaced by Damir Vrancic (Braunschweig).
The game has come to an end for Julian Draxler. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Anthony Annan (Schalke).
After a goalmouth scramble the ball rebounds out to Benjamin Kessel (Braunschweig) who buries it from close range straight into the bottom right corner.

Ralf Fahrmann makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Omar Elabdellaoui (Braunschweig) inside the box and he drills a strike goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
Marcel Correia (Braunschweig) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Wolfgang Stark didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Yellow card. Norman Theuerkauf (Braunschweig) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge. Schalke win a free kick.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar will be replaced by Adam Szalai (Schalke).
Adam Szalai (Schalke) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Daniel Davari is alert and denies him.
Goal!!! Adam Szalai (Schalke) strikes the ball inside the net.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart) is obviously very disappointed with his shot from the rebound. He aims exactly at the goalkeeper's gloves. This should have been an easy goal!
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.

Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) finds himself some space around the penalty spot to connect with a fine free kick. His header is slightly mistimed and sails inches past the right post. It is going to be a goal kick.
Michael Ian Mancienne (Hamburger) connects with the ball in the six-yard box after the resulting free kick and shoots towards the bottom right corner, but Sven Ulreich makes a magnificent save!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) is sent off after receiving a second yellow card from the referee!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch so that Rafael van der Vaart can be given a rest.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Arthur Boka (VfB Stuttgart) is leaving the pitch, and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) will replace him.
Goal! Ibrahima Traore feeds Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 1:0.
Milan Badelj will be replaced by Robert Tesche (Hamburger).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tomas Rincon (Hamburger) replaces Tolgay Arslan.
Konstantin Rausch (VfB Stuttgart) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save. Corner kick. Stuttgart will have an opportunity.
A substitution has been made. Konstantin Rausch goes off and Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Sven Ulreich (VfB Stuttgart) is the one who receives a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ibrahima Traore trots off the pitch and is replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) misses a rebound from the penalty spot. The ball flies just a few inches over the bar. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Ivica Olic picks out Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg), who drives a shot just wide of the right post from the edge of the box. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.

What a chance that is! Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the left post. A goal kick will follow.

Halil Altintop passes to Tobias Werner (Augsburg), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 0:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.

Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though. The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.
The manager has decided to substitute Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) and he has been replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
It's time for a substitution. Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) comes on in place of Raul Bobadilla.

What a chance that is! Andre Hahn (Augsburg) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.
Substitution. Jan Polak (Wolfsburg) replaces Junior Malanda.
Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the left post. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The manager makes a subsitution with Stefan Kutschke (Wolfsburg) coming on for Timm Klose.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Halil Altintop can be given a rest.

The ball hits the back of the net! Ricardo Rodriguez showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) gets onto the scoresheets by sweetly heading it inside the left post  1:1.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Sascha Molders (Augsburg) for Tobias Werner.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) is sent-off after receiving his second yellow card!

Andre Hahn (Augsburg) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the right side of the target, but Diego Benaglio keeps the ball out.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Julian Schuster (Freiburg) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes inside the right post. He makes it 1:0 with this magnificent strike.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) is booked for saying more than Michael Weiner was willing to tolerate.
Karim Guede (Freiburg) finds himself free inside the box and pulls the trigger, but his effort is brilliantly stopped by one of the defending players.

Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post. A short break for the players as the play will restart with a goal kick.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Goal - 2:0! Admir Mehmedi laid the ball off to Felix Klaus (Freiburg), who shot from close range into the left side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) collects a rebound and hits it precisely into the middle of the goal.
Substitution. Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) on for Ludovic Obraniak.
That will be all from Franco Di Santo who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen).
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Felix Klaus (Freiburg).
Goal! Aaron Hunt passes the ball to the feet of Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 3:1.
Aaron Hunt (Werder Bremen) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Felix Klaus leaves the pitch and Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) comes on.

Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) controls the ball and sets off to face the goalkeeper, but deep inside the box the ball bounces up on the uneven surface and makes him miss the strike, sending the ball well over the goal. It's a goal kick.
