Substitution. Philipp Bargfrede leaves the pitch and is replaced by Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen).
The substitution has been made. Philipp Zulechner (Freiburg) has replaced Admir Mehmedi.
Here comes a substitution. Karim Guede is given a rest as he is replaced by Christian Gunter (Freiburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.

What a great touch by Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Eintracht Frankfurt will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) latched on to a lofted pass inside the box, but his header misses to the right of the target.

What an amazing save by Oliver Baumann! Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot low towards the middle of the target, but fails.
Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well. Eintracht Frankfurt earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) wins himself some space inside the box after the corner kick and finishes with a shot which goes inside the right post.
Here comes a substitution. Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) has had enough and is replaced by Felix Klaus (Freiburg).

Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) collects a rebound a long way out and doesn't hesitate to release a goal-bound hammer of a shot. His attempt is precise and towards the roof of the net. It would have probably ended in the back of the net if it wasn't for Oliver Baumann and his brilliant save. The linesman makes the right call and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Alexander Meier goes off the pitch and Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Goal! Karim Guede (Freiburg) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Admir Mehmedi, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
Pirmin Schwegler (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jan Rosenthal (Eintracht Frankfurt) for Takashi Inui.
Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the middle of the goal, and thus alter the score to 0:1.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) was probably a bit loose with his words to Wolfgang Stark, who decides to show him a yellow.
The booking goes to Julian Schuster (Freiburg). Eintracht Frankfurt are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Gelson Fernandes (Freiburg) receives a yellow card. Eintracht Frankfurt have a free kick from a promising distance.
Felix Klaus (Freiburg) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and curls the ball into the top left corner in trademark fashion.

Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) unleashes a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Oliver Baumann thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same. Eintracht Frankfurt have been awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Alexander Madlung did his best and is replaced by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Julian Schuster walks off the pitch and Immanuel Hohn (Freiburg) comes on as a substitute.

Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the right post.
Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour. A free kick to Eintracht Frankfurt.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) produced a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Kevin Trapp thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card. The referee Wolfgang Stark made the right call.
The manager makes a subsitution with Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) coming on for Admir Mehmedi.
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and drills a shot to the middle of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from Oliver Baumann.
Karim Guede (Freiburg) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Kevin Trapp with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:4.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Marco Fritz checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Markus Feulner (Nurnberg) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was! The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the right side of the goal, but Raphael Schafer made a crucial save! Corner kick. Hamburger SV will have an opportunity.

What a great touch by Markus Feulner (Nurnberg)! He picks up a precise pass on the edge of the box and immediately unleashes a shot on goal. His effort, however, only rattles the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
Yellow card. Marvin Plattenhardt (Nurnberg) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent. Hamburger SV earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
What a chance that is! Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the left post!
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Marco Fritz blows his whistle to start the second half.

Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Raphael Schafer pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.

Rafael van der Vaart (Hamburger) receives a precise pass inside the box and drills a promising first-time blast towards the middle of the goal. His effort is blocked by Raphael Schafer who dives to keep the ball out. What a save!
Substitution. Totally exhausted Martin Angha (Nurnberg) is leaving the pitch, and Hanno Balitsch (Nurnberg) will replace him.
That was close. Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) fires a shot from the edge of the box which goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Robert Mak has picked up an injury and is replaced by Jose Campana (Nurnberg).

Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) meets a cross and produces a header towards the left side of the goal, but one of the defending players blocks the effort. Hamburger SV have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) was close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first-time effort from inside the six-yard box. The ball was aimed towards the left post, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to thwart the attempt.
Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) perfectly wriggles his way through two or three opponents, and he produces a shot from the edge of the box which goes into the roof of the net. Wonderful goal!
Here comes a substitution. Javier Pinola is given a rest as he is replaced by Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Rafael van der Vaart as he is replaced by Robert Tesche (Hamburger).
A substitution has been made. Ivo Ilicevic is replaced by Petr Jiracek (Hamburger).

An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Mike Frantz (Nurnberg), who attempted to smack the ball away after a cross, but instead he sends it into the middle of his own goal and behind the goalkeeper's back.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Tomas Rincon (Hamburger) comes onto the pitch so that Tolgay Arslan can be given a rest.
Goal! Markus Feulner tees up Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
Jose Campana (Nurnberg) takes the resulting free kick from 19 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the top right corner, but Rene Adler is alert and keeps the ball out.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Diego Contento (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Markus Schmidt ignores the protests.

Simon Rolfes (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a rebound a long way out and doesn't hesitate to release a goal-bound hammer of a shot. His attempt is precise and towards the roof of the net. It would have probably ended in the back of the net if it wasn't for Manuel Neuer and his brilliant save. Bayer Leverkusen get a corner.

Bastian Schweinsteiger showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the bottom left corner. It's 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Markus Schmidt starts the second half.
What a sweet shot! Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) strikes the ball from the resulting free kick and proves his quality. His shot bounces in off the crossbar.
Markus Schmidt shows the yellow card to Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Arjen Robben leaves the pitch and Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Here comes a substitution. Sidney Sam (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Heung-Min Son.
The game has come to an end for Mario Mandzukic. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich).
The foul by Rafinha (Bayern Munich) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Markus Schmidt.
Substitution. Emre Can is replaced by Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen).
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) for a tough tackle. Bayern Munich win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Toni Kroos (Bayern Munich) is leaving the pitch, and Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) will replace him.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card for a foul.

Roberto Hilbert sends a superb cross into the box. Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the bottom right corner, leaving Manuel Neuer beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:1.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Naldo (Wolfsburg) jumps inside the box to meet the corner and aims a low header towards middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes to stop the effort.
The goalkeeper makes a superb save, but the ball rebounds off him out to Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg), who fires a low drive into the middle of the net.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.

It's a goal! Karim Bellarabi (Braunschweig) scores with a brilliant shot into the right side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Domi Kumbela. The score is 0:1.
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, but it is straight at Daniel Davari.
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) sees a yellow card from Felix Brych after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Naldo (Wolfsburg) for a tough tackle.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Patrick Ochs (Wolfsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) replacing Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
A yellow card for a tackle by Slobodan Medojevic (Wolfsburg). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Here comes a substitution. Bas Dost is given a rest as he is replaced by Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg).
Marc Pfitzner (Braunschweig) comes onto the pitch because Mirko Boland simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Karim Bellarabi will be replaced by Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Braunschweig).
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Substitution. Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Kevin De Bruyne walks off.
The substitution is prepared. Orhan Ademi (Braunschweig) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Domi Kumbela.
That's it for today, Felix Brych has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
The ball rebounds outside of the penalty area and falls to the feet of Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund), who directs his low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper is there to block the effort.

Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Christoph Kramer, but he hits a shot just wide of the right post. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.

Mats Hummels (Dortmund) unleashes a promising shot towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Marc-Andre ter Stegen thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same. Dortmund force their opponents to concede a corner.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Marc-Andre ter Stegen shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box, but the ball crashes against the crossbar! It would have been a superb goal.
Goal! Patrick Herrmann plays a pass to the feet of Raffael (B. Monchengladbach), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 0:1.
It's in the back of the net! Juan Arango picks out Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 0:2.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Deniz Aytekin has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) misses a big opportunity after striking the ball towards goal and it goes just over the crossbar. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Here comes a substitution. Sebastian Kehl (Dortmund) has had enough and is replaced by Milos Jojic (Dortmund).
Close! Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) picks up a pass and produces a ferocious strike towards the right post, but the goalkeeper gets his fingertips to the ball to keep it out.
That's the end of the game for Lukasz Piszczek, who is replaced by Marvin Ducksch (Dortmund).
Deniz Aytekin rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach).
Havard Nordtveit (B. Monchengladbach) must have forgotten about the first yellow card that he received because he is shown a second one by the referee after his bad challenge!
Substitution. Max Kruse leaves the pitch and is replaced by Thorben Marx (B. Monchengladbach).
Milos Jojic (Dortmund) is in the right place at the right time and perfectly hits a rebound into the bottom left corner.
The substitution is prepared. Lukas Rupp (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Patrick Herrmann.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Pierre Aubameyang (Dortmund) left the pitch, and Julian Schieber (Dortmund) is coming on to help his team.
Substitution. Roel Brouwers (B. Monchengladbach) on for Raffael.

Julian Schieber (Dortmund) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends his bullet header just wide of the right post. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
The match has just finished.
Guido Winkmann checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity from the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post. A goal kick will follow.
Leon Andreasen (Hannover) has received a yellow card for his foul. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Hertha Berlin.

Ronny (Hertha Berlin) produces a shot from a mid-range free kick. His effort is directed under the crossbar but is caught by the goalkeeper. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Hertha Berlin.

Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) receives a low pass just outside the box and drills a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
It is time for a substitution. Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) is on for Artjoms Rudnevs.
Ronny picks out Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin), who drives a shot just wide of the right post from the edge of the box. It is going to be a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Leonardo Bittencourt feeds the ball through to Lars Stindl (Hannover), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the right side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:0!
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and drills a shot to the bottom right corner, but is denied by a reflex save from Ron-Robert Zieler.

Excellent touch by Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
Ronny (Hertha Berlin) does well to meet a cross from Hajime Hosogai, but he directs his shot just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
Goal! Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 0:2. He was ably assisted there by Leonardo Bittencourt.

Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) shows good awareness deep inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the resulting free kick. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and flies inches wide of the left-hand post. That will be a goal kick.
Substitution. Hajime Hosogai makes his way off the pitch and Hany Mukhtar (Hertha Berlin) comes on as his replacement.
Substitution. Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) has come on for Per Skjelbred.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Salif Sane (Hannover) will replace Manuel Schmiedebach.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin).
Andre Hoffmann (Hannover) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Ronny (Hertha Berlin) skips past the defenders and unloads a rocket of a shot from 30 metres. Unfortunately for him, his fabulous effort ricochets away off the crossbar.
Today's match ends for Leonardo Bittencourt who will be replaced by Didier Ya Konan (Hannover).
Goal! Didier Ya Konan displays great vision and sends a pass to Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top right corner. The score is 0:3.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
A clumsy foul by Nikolce Noveski (Mainz) and Daniel Siebert blows his whistle. Hoffenheim are awarded a penalty!
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) doesn't keep his cool and fails to convert the penalty. He skies the ball way over the bar and into the stands.
A precise cross towards the penalty spot was latched onto by Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim). He outjumped the defence and produced a decent header which went a whisker wide of the left post.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) meets a splendid cross on the edge of the 6-yard box and sends the ball towards the left post, forcing Loris Karius into a superb diving save to keep it out.
Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee. Mainz are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.

What a chance that is! Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the left post. That will be a goal kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot inside the right post. His attempt was beyond the reach of Loris Karius, so the score changes to 0:0.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) takes a snap shot from the edge of the 18-yard box which goes inside the right post. What a hit that is!
Today's match ends for Junior Diaz who will be replaced by Benedikt Saller (Mainz).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nicolai Muller (Mainz) replaces Johannes Geis.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kenan Karaman (Hoffenheim) is coming onto the pitch as Anthony Modeste cannot continue after picking up an injury.
What a magnificent finish! Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) wonderfully times his run onto a cross and thunders the ball from deep inside the box into the left side of the net!
That's the end of the game for Ja-Cheol Koo, who is replaced by Yunus Malli (Mainz).
Benedikt Saller (Mainz) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Benedikt Saller (Mainz) is in the right place at the right time and hammers a rebound straight into the roof of the net!

Maxim Choupo-Moting sends a superb cross into the box. Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the roof of the net, leaving Koen Casteels beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:3.
It is time for a substitution. Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim) is on for Andreas Beck.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fabian Johnson departs the field of play to be replaced by Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim).

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Shinji Okazaki (Mainz). Nicolai Muller plays a fantastic through ball and finds Shinji Okazaki (Mainz), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 2:4.
That's it for today, Daniel Siebert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Referee Thorsten Kinhofer blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Thorsten Kinhofer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the right post by a whisker. It will be a goal kick.
Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) receives a harsh yellow card from the referee after committing a minor foul on his opponent.
Luca Caldirola slides a brilliant pass into Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker over the crossbar. That will be a goal kick.
Konstantin Rausch (VfB Stuttgart) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post. A goal kick will follow.
Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. Stuttgart are given a huge opportunity to score - it's a penalty kick!
Assani Lukimya (Werder Bremen) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) doesn't keep his cool and fails to convert the penalty. His shot flies miles wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Thorsten Kinhofer starts the second half.
Close! Ludovic Obraniak (Werder Bremen) stands over the resulting free kick from around 20 metres out and his shot goes just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) fires the ball towards the right side of the goal from close-range, but his shot is blocked by one of the defenders. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Stuttgart.

Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the bottom right corner. Raphael Wolf shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
The goalkeeper makes a superb save, but the ball rebounds off him out to Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart), who fires it into the top right corner.
Here comes a substitution. Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) has had enough and is replaced by Martin Kobylanski (Werder Bremen).

Martin Harnik links up with Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Martin Harnik sprays a pass out to Gotoku Sakai (VfB Stuttgart), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes high over the bar. It's a goal kick.
Substitution. Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen) on for Ludovic Obraniak.
Aaron Hunt (Werder Bremen) scores from the resulting free kick from 20 metres out. He displays that he is a brilliant free kick taker and curls the ball into the bottom right corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Ibrahima Traore cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Substitution. Cacau is replaced by Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) collects a rebound and hits it precisely into the bottom right corner.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) is booked by the referee.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
After the keeper softly punches the ball away, it lands at the feet of Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) who knows what to do with it and sends it low into the middle of the goal.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) picks up a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Today's match ends for Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) who will be replaced by Kaan Ayhan.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Sead Kolasinac provides Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
A yellow card for a tackle by Kaan Ayhan (Schalke). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Great chance! Halil Altintop (Augsburg) collects a great pass inside the box, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Julian Draxler (Schalke) gets booked.
The referee signals a substitution. Arkadiusz Milik (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Raul Bobadilla.
We are about to witness a substitution. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) is replacing Dominik Kohr.
Substitution. Max Meyer (Schalke) has come on for Julian Draxler.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) replaces Tobias Werner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Adam Szalai (Schalke) comes onto the pitch so that Klaas-Jan Huntelaar can be given a rest.
Adam Szalai (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Florian Meyer checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but luckily for the goalkeeper he steers his header just over the crossbar. That will be a goal kick.

Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the middle of the target, but Loris Karius keeps the ball out.

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and drills a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. His dangerous effort is blocked by Thomas Kraft, who makes a glorious save!

Shawn Parker (Mainz) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards the right side of the goal, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper with a stunning save.

Shawn Parker (Mainz) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Thomas Kraft to get hold of the ball. Mainz earn a corner.
Joo-Ho Park (Mainz) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Florian Meyer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Today's match ends for Marcel N'Djeng who will be replaced by Ronny (Hertha Berlin).
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

What a wasted opportunity by Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the right side of the goal, but Loris Karius makes an astonishing save to thwart him. The ball is out of play. Hertha Berlin will have a chance to score from a corner.
Per Skjelbred feeds the ball through to Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:0!

Nikolce Noveski (Mainz) shows good awareness inside the box to meet a delightful cross from the free kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post. A short break for the players as the play will restart with a goal kick.
Substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) replaces Shawn Parker.

Ronny (Hertha Berlin) tries his luck and hits a thunderbolt of a shot towards goal from long range, but his powerful strike goes narrowly wide of the left post. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.

Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Florian Meyer blows his whistle for an infringement. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to Mainz.
What was Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) scores from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Substitution. Per Skjelbred did his best and is replaced by Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin).
Loris Karius reacts well to deny a long-range free kick from Ronny (Hertha Berlin) towards the middle of the goal.
Loris Karius pulls off a great save to deny Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nicolai Muller departs the field of play to be replaced by Junior Diaz (Mainz).

Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the crossbar. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Thomas Kraft with a fabulous save. Mainz will take a corner kick.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) for Sami Allagui.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Maxim Choupo-Moting will be replaced by Yunus Malli (Mainz).
Christoph Moritz (Mainz) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Gelson Fernandes (Freiburg) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
What was Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Sokratis (Dortmund) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Peter Gagelmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Golden chance! Julian Schieber (Dortmund) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post. That will be a goal kick.
A wonderful pass found its target. Sebastian Kehl (Dortmund) received it well and shot from about 25 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and under the bar.
Substitution. Nuri Sahin did his best and is replaced by Oliver Kirch (Dortmund).
The substitution has been made. Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) has replaced Vladimir Darida.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Philipp Zulechner walks off the pitch to be replaced by Felix Klaus (Freiburg).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) for Julian Schieber.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Schuster leaves the pitch and Francis Coquelin (Freiburg) comes on.
Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) sends in a shot from a promising distance after a precise pass. His effort goes inches over the crossbar. The play will restart with a goal kick.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan goes off the pitch and Manuel Friedrich (Dortmund) comes on.
The match has just finished.
Referee Manuel Grafe blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the bar. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
The game has begun to heat up. Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle. A free kick is awarded to Nurnberg.
What was Ludovic Obraniak (Werder Bremen) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Aaron Hunt (Werder Bremen) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the right post! What a shot that was!
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) is first to latch on to a rebound and blasts the ball into the middle of the net. Unstoppable strike!
Zlatko Junuzovic (Werder Bremen) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Raphael Schafer (Nurnberg) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Patrick Rakovsky (Nurnberg) will take his place on the pitch.
The whistle blows and Manuel Grafe starts the second half.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to  for his blatant foul. Werder Bremen will take a free kick.
The manager has decided to substitute Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) and he has been replaced by Cedric Makiadi (Werder Bremen).
The referee signals a substitution. Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg) is brought on as a substitute for Robert Mak.
Adam Hlousek (Nurnberg) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.

The defending players give Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) far too much free space and he knows how to take advantage of it. He produces a howitzer in the direction of the bottom right corner. Raphael Schafer was taken unawares by his effort and the score is 0:1.
A substitution has been made. Ludovic Obraniak goes off and Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Jose Campana (Nurnberg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Substitution. Jose Campana makes his way off the pitch and Antonio-Mirko Colak (Nurnberg) comes on as his replacement.
Today's match ends for Aleksandar Ignjovski who will be replaced by Clemens Fritz (Werder Bremen).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen) was quite harsh and Manuel Grafe didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. A free kick to Nurnberg.

Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar! The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.
Aaron Hunt (Werder Bremen) zig-zags his way into the box and fails to direct a shot into the roof of the net as the goalkeeper pulls off a miraculous stop.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Nice piece of skill by Raffael (B. Monchengladbach). He perfectly collected a pass from Havard Nordtveit and unleashed a fantastic long-range strike which went into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save!

Kevin Vogt (Augsburg) reacted quickly inside the box and got on the end of the resulting corner. He drilled a low shot towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulled off an astonishing save to deny him.

Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and drills a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Alex Manninger has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. The ball is out of play. B. Monchengladbach win a corner kick.
Goal! Andre Hahn provides Halil Altintop (Augsburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Knut Kircher starts the second half.
Jan Moravek (Augsburg) whips a volley from long range towards the goal. His beautiful effort whistles wide of the left post.
CLOSE! Tobias Werner (Augsburg) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker departs the field of play to be replaced by Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg).
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann is replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a pass inside the box, but his low effort towards the right post is well blocked. B. Monchengladbach will take a corner kick.
Here's the change. Max Kruse leaves the pitch and Peniel Kokou Mlapa (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch for Raul Bobadilla.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Augsburg) rises above the defence inside the box, but his header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Goal! Andre Hahn puts a cross into the box and finds Tobias Werner (Augsburg), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:2.
The referee signals a substitution. Amin Younes (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Havard Nordtveit.
Halil Altintop goes off the pitch and Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) comes on.
Peniel Kokou Mlapa (B. Monchengladbach) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the left post is smartly dealt with by Alex Manninger.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper leaps from the ground and makes a stunning save. Eintracht Frankfurt force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the left side of the goal.

Johan Djourou (Hamburger) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it's not accurate and goes narrowly wide of the left post. That will be a goal kick.
Tranquillo Barnetta (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) goes into the book for bad language. His vulgar comments could have made it worse. Luckily for him, it's a yellow card.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Michael Weiner didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Hamburger SV are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
Here comes a substitution. Robert Tesche (Hamburger) is brought on as a substitute for Tomas Rincon.
Michael Weiner shows a yellow card to Milan Badelj (Hamburger) for his blatant foul.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexander Meier leaves the pitch and Jan Rosenthal (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.

Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the left-hand post, but Kevin Trapp was alert and the score remains the same. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Hamburger SV.
Carlos Zambrano (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Weiner had an easy-decision to make. Hamburger SV are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) leaves the keeper helpless with his precise penalty shot into the top right corner.
Substitution. Tranquillo Barnetta walks off the pitch and Tobias Weis (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Here's the change. Stefan Aigner leaves the pitch and Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.

Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) wins himself just enough space to meet the resulting corner and shoots towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper makes a great save and gets the ball under control.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Roberto Hilbert (Bayer Leverkusen) brings an opponent down and Felix Zwayer interrupts the game. PENALTY AWARDED to Hannover!

Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) steps up to the penalty spot. He attempts to confuse the goalkeeper by stopping in the middle of his run up and sends the ball to the bottom right corner, but Bernd Leno keeps his cool to thwart him. Good work from Hannover as they win a corner.
Edgar Prib (Hannover) comes onto the pitch after Mame Diouf signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Jens Hegeler leaves the pitch to be replaced by Sidney Sam (Bayer Leverkusen).
Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a rebound and hits it precisely into the top left corner.
A wonderful pass found its target. Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover) received it well and shot from about 22 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and into the top left corner.
Andre Hoffmann (Hannover) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball bounced away off the left post!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Felix Zwayer blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Leon Andreasen (Hannover) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Heung-Min Son leaves the pitch and Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul.

Unbelievable! Christian Schulz (Hannover) wastes a huge scoring opportunity! He finds himself unmarked right in front of goal and fires in a first-time shot. Bernd Leno pulls off one of the best saves of his career and stops the effort from hitting the net.
Substitution. Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) has come on for Stefan Kiessling.
Leon Andreasen has picked up an injury and is replaced by Salif Sane (Hannover).
Substitution. Totally exhausted Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) is leaving the pitch, and Didier Ya Konan (Hannover) will replace him.
Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Bernd Leno makes a great save to stop his effort.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the left side of the goal.

Ralf Fahrmann can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom left corner.
Tim Hoogland (Schalke) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post. That will be a goal kick.
Tempers flare after Julian Draxler (Schalke) committed a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely he must be relieved for not getting a red card. A free kick to Hoffenheim.
Goal! Julian Draxler tees up Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) makes a slide tackle, but referee Robert Hartmann blows for a foul. Schalke are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.
What was Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Penalty saved! Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) sends the penalty towards the middle of the target, but Koen Casteels doesn't move and easily saves the effort.

Julian Draxler (Schalke) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Koen Casteels, who pulls off a stunning save! It will be a corner kick for Schalke.
The end of the first half.
Robert Hartmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The manager has decided to substitute Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) and he has been replaced by Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim).
The game has come to an end for Kai Herdling. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim).
Julian Draxler (Schalke) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post. It will be a goal kick.
Golden chance! Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post. It's a goal kick.
Tim Hoogland (Schalke) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Koen Casteels makes a great save to stop his effort.
Goal! Kevin-Prince Boateng slips it to Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom left corner with a great effort. The score is 3:0.
Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Substitution. Anthony Modeste makes way for Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim).
It's time for a substitution. Christian Fuchs (Schalke) comes on in place of Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke.

Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
It's in the back of the net! Julian Draxler picks out Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 4:0.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Klaas-Jan Huntelaar walks off the pitch to be replaced by Adam Szalai (Schalke).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Julian Draxler departs the field of play to be replaced by Max Meyer (Schalke).

Koen Casteels makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Adam Szalai (Schalke) inside the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Hartmann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Sead Kolasinac (Schalke) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
That's it for today, Robert Hartmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Daniel Schwaab (VfB Stuttgart) sees a yellow card from Christian Dingert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort into the top right corner.

A superb goal from great team play! Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent shot inside the right post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) perfectly wriggles his way through two or three opponents, and he produces a low drive from the edge of the box which goes inside the left post. Wonderful goal!
Marc Pfitzner (Braunschweig) gets a yellow card for protesting.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.

Daniel Davari (Braunschweig) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows for a foul after seeing the whole situation. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to Stuttgart.

Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) doesn't take advantage of the chance to score from the penalty spot. He shoots to the bottom right corner, but Daniel Davari leaps out to thwart his effort. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Stuttgart.

What a wasted chance that is! A precise cross into the box found Norman Theuerkauf (Braunschweig), whose header floated just over the bar. A short break for the players as the play will restart with a goal kick.
That's the end of the game for Havard Kallevik Nielsen, who is replaced by Orhan Ademi (Braunschweig).
A substitution has been made. Marc Pfitzner is replaced by Timo Perthel (Braunschweig).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Rani Khedira (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Alexandru Maxim.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Ken Reichel walks off the pitch to be replaced by Damir Vrancic (Braunschweig).

Benjamin Kessel (Braunschweig) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the top of the net, but Sven Ulreich keeps the ball out. The ball is out of play. Braunschweig win a corner kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Arthur Boka cannot continue after picking up an injury.
It's in the back of the net! Domi Kumbela picks out Ermin Bicakcic (Braunschweig) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 2:2.
Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) is the one who receives a yellow card.
The referee signals a substitution. Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Cacau.
Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Benjamin Kessel (Braunschweig) receives a yellow card.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Tobias Welz checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne puts a cross into the box and finds Naldo (Wolfsburg), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Dante (Bayern Munich) meets a cross and produces a header towards the bottom left corner, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.

Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the bottom left corner that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
Goal! Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 1:1.
Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) shows good awareness inside the box, but his attempt is stopped by the goalkeeper.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Manuel Neuer is alert and denies him.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
A dangerous towering header by Naldo (Wolfsburg) from around the penalty spot goes just wide of the right post. This corner kick didn't change the score. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.
The game has come to an end for Xherdan Shaqiri. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) will replace Toni Kroos.
Slobodan Medojevic (Wolfsburg) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the left post. It will be a goal kick.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) latched on to an accurate pass deep into the box and attempted to fire the ball past the keeper, but the shot is way off target. What a miskick! The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.
Goal! Thiago Alcantara passes the ball to the feet of Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 1:2.

Rafinha produces a sweet pass and picks out Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:1!
Philipp Lahm will be replaced by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).

Arjen Robben is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom left corner to make the score 1:4.
Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.

A perfect lofted pass from Arjen Robben finds Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the top left corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Diego Benaglio had no chance of stopping that. 1:1.
Jan Polak (Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Maximilian Arnold.
A substitution has been made. Daniel Caligiuri goes off and Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) comes on.
It's in the back of the net! Thomas Muller sprays a pass out to Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:6.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Kevin De Bruyne as he is replaced by Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg).
Tobias Welz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Tranquillo Barnetta (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to an accurate cross on the edge of the penalty box and sends the ball straight in the middle with a precise header. No problem for the keeper as he punched the ball away.

Alexandru Maxim passes to Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 0:1.

Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the roof of the net. Kevin Trapp is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. The ball goes out for a corner. Stuttgart can continue in their attacking effort.
Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) after a cross wins the header inside the box and steers it goalwards, but Sven Ulreich produces a wonderful reflex save.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Deniz Aytekin has ended it.
Joselu will be replaced by Jan Rosenthal (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The second half has just started.
Sebastian Jung (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Deniz Aytekin didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Sven Ulreich pulls off a brilliant save! Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) launched himself and met a cross into the box, but his header to the right post is saved. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Eintracht Frankfurt.
Substitution. Bastian Oczipka is replaced by Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Georg Niedermeier (VfB Stuttgart) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the right post. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.
Goal! Jan Rosenthal (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and fires the ball past the goalkeeper.
Today's match ends for Alexandru Maxim who will be replaced by Rani Khedira (VfB Stuttgart).
That will be all from Cacau who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart).
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Johannes Flum, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 2:1.
It's time for a substitution. Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart) comes on in place of Arthur Boka.
Johannes Flum comes off the pitch to be replaced by Tobias Weis (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) receives a delightful pass inside the box and fires the ball into the top right corner. What a lovely finish!
Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Markus Schmidt had an easy-decision to make.

It's a goal! Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Ivan Perisic and planted his close-range header low into the middle of the goal. Koen Casteels was helpless.

Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 20 metres out, but it missed the left post by a whisker. It is going to be a goal kick.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) looks like he will be the one to take the corner kick. Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his strike flies just a few inches over the bar. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
The ball is whipped in from the resulting set piece and finds the head of Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim) who rises and produces an amazing header into the bottom right corner.
Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass just outside the box and drills a glorious strike into the bottom left corner off the post. The goalkeeper was helpless.

Excellent touch by Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save. The linesman points to the corner flag, Hoffenheim are going to take it.
Sebastian Rudy produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) rises high to head the ball into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 4:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Slobodan Medojevic will be replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
The referee signals a substitution. Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) is brought on as a substitute for Anthony Modeste.
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne provides Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom right corner. 4:2.
Substitution. Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) has come on for Robin Knoche.
The referee makes a quick call and awards Christian Trasch (Wolfsburg) a red card. Penalty! A huge opportunity to score for Hoffenheim.
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) unleashes a strong shot and sends the goalkeeper the wrong way. An easy goal.
Substitution. Ivan Perisic did his best and is replaced by Patrick Ochs (Wolfsburg).

Goal! Sejad Salihovic displays great vision and sends a pass to Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 6:2.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jeremy Toljan (Hoffenheim) coming on for Fabian Johnson.
Substitution. Roberto Firmino will be replaced by Kenan Karaman (Hoffenheim).
That's it for today, Markus Schmidt has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) takes the free kick from a promising position. He has already proven that he can handle such situations and once again, he sends the ball into the back of the net!
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and scores with aplomb inside the left post. What a beautiful shot.
Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) leaps to meet a beautiful cross and produces a header which goes low inside the right post.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) receives a great chance inside the box and drills a shot into the bottom left corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Fuchs (Schalke) replaces Leon Goretzka.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a great save to deny Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Dante (Bayern Munich) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header inches over the bar. It's a goal kick.

The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.

This is really unlucky! Rafinha (Bayern Munich) attempted to clear the ball away after the oppositions corner kick into the box, but he miskicked the clearance and placed it into his own net, specifically into the bottom right corner. He won't enjoy watching the highlights later.
Mario Gotze comes off the pitch to be replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich).

Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and releases a quick shot that sails towards the middle of a goal. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save.
Jochen Drees is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Andre Hahn (Augsburg) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Ron-Robert Zieler stops the ball from going into the top of the net. Now Augsburg have a corner.

Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the top of the net, but Alex Manninger makes a brilliant save! The ball goes out of play and Hannover have been awarded a corner kick.
Mame Diouf (Hannover) was like a fox in the box, burying the ball into the bottom right corner of the goal. Excellent finish!
Paul Verhaegh has picked up an injury and is replaced by Jan Moravek (Augsburg).

Mame Diouf (Hannover) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the left by a whisker. It is going to be a goal kick.
Lars Stindl (Hannover) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. A goal kick will follow.

Halil Altintop (Augsburg) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.

Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the right post. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.

Tobias Werner (Augsburg) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the left side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Ron-Robert Zieler, who keeps it out. Augsburg earn a corner.

Halil Altintop (Augsburg) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and releases a quick shot that sails to the top right corner. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper dives to make a stunning save.
Tobias Werner sends in a great cross from the corner and finds Ragnar Klavan (Augsburg), who outjumps the defence to finish into the top left corner with a header. The score is 1:1.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jan Moravek (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.
Today's referee Manuel Grafe rightly decides to book Daniel Baier (Augsburg) for his harsh tackle.
Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) stands over the free kick from 30 out and sends a wonderful curling shot that goes into the top left corner. What a goal that is!
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Gelson Fernandes (Freiburg) for a heavy challenge.
Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) latches on to a precise cross on the edge of the box and strikes the ball goalwards. However, it whistles wide of the left post so the goalkeeper can relax.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Substitution. Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker walks off.
Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) meets a cross inside the box and heads it goalwards. Unfortunately for him, he sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a chance!
A substitution has been made. Dong-Won Ji goes off and Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) comes on.

Goal! Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Alex Manninger is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 2:1.
Felix Klaus (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Paul Verhaegh (Augsburg) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and fires into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Felix Klaus comes off the pitch to be replaced by Francis Coquelin (Freiburg).

Pavel Krmas (Freiburg) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the left side of the goal. Alex Manninger shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) receives a great chance inside the box and drills a shot into the bottom left corner.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Christian Gunter (Freiburg) receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Gelson Fernandes (Freiburg) will be replaced by Philipp Zulechner.
The manager has decided to substitute Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) and he has been replaced by Julian Schuster (Freiburg).
It is time for a substitution. Jan Moravek (Augsburg) is on for Halil Altintop.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) is in the right place at the right time and perfectly hits a rebound into the bottom left corner.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Felix Brych checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Close! Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post. A goal kick will follow.
Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) unleashes a powerful shot towards goal from a mid-range free kick, but the ball is blocked by the defensive wall.
Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls it and sends it straight at Roman Weidenfeller, who makes a comfortable save.

What a chance that is! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out for a corner. Dortmund can continue in their attacking effort.
Petr Jiracek (Hamburger) heads the ball inside the left post after a splendid cross. This timely header produces a wonderful moment.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Sven Bender makes his way off the pitch and Marco Reus (Dortmund) comes on as his replacement.
What was Tomas Rincon (Hamburger) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Yellow card. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom right corner.

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot towards the roof of the net. His promising effort is kept out by Rene Adler, who pulls off a stunning save!
The game has come to an end for Robert Lewandowski. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Marvin Ducksch (Dortmund).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Kevin Grosskreutz as he is replaced by Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund).
It is time for a substitution. Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) is on for Pierre-Michel Lasogga.
Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a yellow card! Hamburger SV have been awarded a free kick.

Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the top left corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 3:0.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) gets on the end of a pass and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's blocked by one of the defending players. Braunschweig have been awarded a corner kick.
Martin Angha (Nurnberg) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.

Hiroshi Kiyotake (Nurnberg) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Marjan Petkovic was alert and the score remained the same. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Nurnberg.
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) takes a nice first touch to control a cross and fires in from the penalty spot, but his effort zooms just past the right post.
Per Nilsson (Nurnberg) leaves his team at a huge disadvantage as he is sent off.
The manager has decided to substitute Timo Gebhart (Nurnberg) and he has been replaced by Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg).
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) leaps high to connect with the resulting corner and plants a header into the bottom left corner of the target, beating the goalkeeper.

Raphael Schafer (Nurnberg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Daniel Siebert doesn't think twice to pull it out of his pocket. A penalty for a foul is awarded to Braunschweig.
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the bottom right corner, but Raphael Schafer pulls off a superb save.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Nurnberg) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Daniel Siebert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Adam Hlousek trots off the pitch and is replaced by Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg).
Amazing piece of skill! Hiroshi Kiyotake (Nurnberg) picks up a cross on the edge of the 18-yard box and hammers the ball precisely into the bottom left corner. What a finish!
Goal! Josip Drmic slips it to Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg) on the edge of the box and he lashes the ball low into the middle of the net. The score is 2:1.

Raphael Schafer pulls off a great save to deny Benjamin Kessel (Braunschweig), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal. The ball is out of play. Braunschweig will have a chance to score from a corner.
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) meets a precise pass with a nice touch on the edge of the box and produces a shot to the middle of the goal. What an excellent save by the goalkeeper!
Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Braunschweig) finds enough space to climb high and plants a header way over the bar. What a poor effort.

Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Braunschweig) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and rose high to reach a fine corner kick. He fails to direct the ball past the goalkeeper as it flies narrowly over the bar.
A player from Nurnberg pulled an opponent down, forcing the referee to blow his whistle. Braunschweig are awarded a penalty kick!
Ermin Bicakcic (Braunschweig) misses the penalty! He unleashed a low drive towards the middle of the net, but the goalkeeper pulled off a reflex save to deny him.
A player from Braunschweig takes his opponent down, the referee blows his whistle for a foul. The referee makes the call - penalty to Nurnberg!
Ken Reichel (Braunschweig) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Hiroshi Kiyotake (Nurnberg) fails to score from the penalty. He aimed his shot towards the left side of the goal, but it was too weak to go past Marjan Petkovic who made a reflex save and deflected the ball onto the post.
Today's match ends for Hiroshi Kiyotake who will be replaced by Emanuel Pogatetz (Nurnberg).
Marc Pfitzner (Braunschweig) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg) is not given a chance to finish after receiving a sweet pass by Josip Drmi (Nurnberg).
The substitution has been made. Damir Vrancic (Braunschweig) has replaced Marc Pfitzner.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Havard Kallevik Nielsen (Braunschweig) left the pitch, and Orhan Ademi (Braunschweig) is coming on to help his team.
The foul by Javier Pinola (Nurnberg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Daniel Siebert.

Mirko Boland (Braunschweig) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him. The linesman points to the corner flag, Braunschweig are going to take it.

Orhan Ademi (Braunschweig) is picked up by one of his teammates with a brilliant low pass, but he doesn't receive the ball well. The defence eliminates the danger without any problem. He could have found himself in a good chance to score.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

A superb goal from great team play! Levan Kobiashvili (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the left post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.

Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and releases a quick shot that sails towards the right post. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper dives to make a stunning save.
