Rani Khedira (VfB Stuttgart) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Thomas Kraft makes a great save to stop his effort.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Arthur Boka (VfB Stuttgart) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a strong shot into the top of the net. His attempt was beyond the reach of Thomas Kraft, so the score changes to 1:1.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Robert Hartmann starts the second half.
What was Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
A substitution has been made. Mohammed Abdellaoue goes off and Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.

What an opportunity! Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) wins the ball from the resulting set piece and unleashes a precise shot from inside the goal area which sails narrowly wide of the right post! The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
The manager has decided to substitute Rani Khedira (VfB Stuttgart) and he has been replaced by Robin Yalcin (VfB Stuttgart).
The substitution has been made. Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) has replaced Nico Schulz.
Substitution. Marcel N'Djeng walks off the pitch and John Brooks (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.

It's in the back of the net! Tolga Cigerci flights in the free kick and the ball finds the head of Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin), whose excellent bullet header from the centre of the box goes into the right side of the goal. 1:2.
The yellow card is received by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
The game is help up as Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin) is shown a red card, following two cautions, and has to leave the pitch.
That will be all from Adrian Ramos who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Daniel Schwaab is replaced by Karim Haggui (VfB Stuttgart).
Robert Hartmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Referee Peter Gagelmann blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

That was absolutely fantastic! Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) tries his luck with a hammer shot from long range, but his effort only rattles the crossbar! Here is an example of luck not being on your side.

A neat pass is well received by Elkin Soto (Mainz), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible diving save to block his shot. It will be a corner kick for Mainz.
Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out.
That was close by Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.

Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed into the top left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. Mainz will have a chance to score from a corner kick.

Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) gets in a promising position to score after he received a precise pass from  inside the six-yard box. Unfortunately for him, one of the defenders pulls off a great save and deflects his effort onto the post. Schalke have a corner.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Peter Gagelmann starts the second half.

Junior Diaz (Mainz) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee. Joel Matip (Schalke) is ready to take a free kick from a distance of 46 metres. Will he decide to have a direct shot at goal or will he cross the ball into the penalty box?
Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a great save to block a header from Stefan Bell (Mainz) after a nice lofted cross.
Max Meyer (Schalke) makes a yard for himself and unleashes a stunning shot from 30 metres out. His great effort, however, goes painfully wide of the right post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Julian Draxler (Schalke) coming on for Max Meyer.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Nicolai Muller (Mainz).
Substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo will be replaced by Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz).
We are about to witness a substitution. Shawn Parker (Mainz) is replacing Shinji Okazaki.

Johannes Geis (Mainz) releases a promising shot from the free kick from around 33 metres out. The ball goes towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper makes a decent save and denies him.
Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) has tested the patience of referee Peter Gagelmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leon Goretzka departs the field of play to be replaced by Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke).
It's time for a substitution. Benedikt Saller (Mainz) comes on in place of Nicolai Muller.

Zdenek Pospech (Mainz) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires the ball from the edge of the box to the right side of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann shows his agility and makes a save. The referee points to the corner flag and Mainz will take a corner.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Klaas-Jan Huntelaar walks off the pitch to be replaced by Adam Szalai (Schalke).
Peter Gagelmann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) collects a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which is brilliantly blocked by a defender.
Goal! Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.

Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) plants a nice towering header goalwards, but one of the defenders is in the right place at the right time and makes a vital clearance. Hertha Berlin have been awarded a corner kick.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.

Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Thomas Kraft guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) launches himself at the ball from the free kick and produces a header which lacks accuracy, sending it just over the bar. The linesman makes the right call and Wolfsburg will have a corner.
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but it's just a bit too high and misses the bar by a whisker.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) jumps to win the corner and puts the ball into the middle of the net. The goalkeeper was unable to keep it out.

What a big chance! Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Hertha Berlin.
Substitution. Ivan Perisic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Sami Allagui will be replaced by Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin).

Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the bottom right corner, but is thwarted by a great save from Diego Benaglio.

Kevin De Bruyne passes to Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Per Skjelbred leaves the pitch and Ronny (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Timm Klose (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card.
Anis Ben-Hatira (Hertha Berlin) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar!
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Hany Mukhtar (Hertha Berlin) replacing Tolga Cigerci (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Kevin De Bruyne walks off.
Substitution. Bas Dost did his best and is replaced by Stefan Kutschke (Wolfsburg).
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Robert Mak (Nurnberg) wins himself enough space to connect with a cross inside the box, but his fine header goes narrowly over the crossbar! The ball is out of play. Goal kick.
This is a yellow card! Hiroshi Kiyotake (Nurnberg) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Arkadiusz Milik (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.

Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Alex Manninger leaps like a salmon to deny him.

Arkadiusz Milik (Augsburg) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom right corner, but Raphael Schafer made an astonishing save! The ball goes out of play and Augsburg have been awarded a corner kick.
Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) is penalised.

Kevin Vogt (Augsburg) almost scores with a cheeky low shot towards goal that goes under the defensive wall, but Raphael Schafer is alert and makes a good save. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the left post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jose Campana (Nurnberg) replacing Hiroshi Kiyotake (Nurnberg).
The manager makes a subsitution with Timo Gebhart (Nurnberg) coming on for Robert Mak.
A substitution has been made. Arkadiusz Milik goes off and Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) comes on.
GOAL! Adam Hlousek produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) rises high to head the ball into the bottom right corner and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 0:1.
Substitution. Kevin Vogt makes his way off the pitch and Jan Moravek (Augsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Matthias Ostrzolek (Augsburg) gets booked.
Markus Feulner (Nurnberg) has a sight of goal and shoots from long range but his ambitious effort flies just over the bar.
Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends his bullet header just wide of the right post.
What a huge chance for Andre Hahn (Augsburg). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Substitution. Timo Gebhart walks off the pitch and Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Erik Thommy (Augsburg) in, Tobias Werner out.
Halil Altintop (Augsburg) gets his head on the corner, but he sees his header blocked.
Erik Thommy (Augsburg) strikes the ball from a mid-range free kick towards the top left corner of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save. Good work from Augsburg as they win a corner.
Jose Campana (Nurnberg) earns the yellow card.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) was in a good shooting position inside the six-yard box and produced a first-time shot towards the inside of the right post, but the goalkeeper made an astonishing save to thwart him.
Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) latched on to a lofted pass inside the box, but his header misses to the right of the target. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Bernd Leno with a strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 0:1.
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Leon Goretzka (Schalke) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
That's a clear yellow card. Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) goes into the book.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Michael Weiner starts the second half.

OFF THE POST! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky. It is going to be a goal kick.
Sebastian Boenisch (Bayer Leverkusen) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.

Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) takes the free kick and unleashes a strong shot from the edge of the box. Unfortunately for him, the ball curls inches over the crossbar. What a squandered chance! The play will restart with a goal kick.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Omer Toprak (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace Emir Spahic.
Felipe Santana (Schalke) gets on the scoresheet, but unfortunately for him it's an own goal.

What a great touch by Gonzalo Castro (Bayer Leverkusen)! He picks up a precise pass on the edge of the box and immediately unleashes a shot on goal. His effort, however, only rattles the right post. What an unlucky moment for him. The ball goes to play from a goal kick.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) leaps above the defence and scores with a sweet header into the top right corner of the goal.
Leon Goretzka comes off the pitch to be replaced by Christian Fuchs (Schalke).
Here comes a substitution. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Heung-Min Son.
Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a yellow card from the referee, but it seems like a very harsh decision.
Substitution. Max Meyer makes way for Kaan Ayhan (Schalke).
Substitution. Totally exhausted Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) is leaving the pitch, and Jens Hegeler (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace him.
Substitution. Tim Hoogland did his best and is replaced by Kyriakos Papadopoulos (Schalke).
Joel Matip (Schalke) receives a harsh yellow card from the referee after committing a minor foul on his opponent.
Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) is cautioned and receives a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Dante (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of a cross and scores with a fine header that goes inside the right post!

Close! Rafinha (Bayern Munich) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post. A short break for the players as the play will restart with a goal kick.
What outstanding solo play by Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) as he slipped through inside the box to unleash a shot towards the net. He aimed perfectly and coolly fired it inside the left post.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly over the crossbar. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.
Toni Kroos feeds the ball through to Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 3:0!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and rose high to reach a fine corner kick. He fails to direct the ball past the goalkeeper as it flies narrowly over the bar. The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads it low towards the left side of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Bastian Schweinsteiger (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Xherdan Shaqiri can be given a rest.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) is coming onto the pitch as Felix Klaus cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Philipp Lahm trots off the pitch and is replaced by Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich).
Toni Kroos (Bayern Munich) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Close! Sebastian Kerk (Freiburg) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
The substitution is prepared. Julian Schuster (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Matthias Ginter.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Daniel van Buyten (Bayern Munich) will replace Arjen Robben.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Dante (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge.

Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the right post. The play will restart with a goal kick.

Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) scores with a great individual effort! He makes a good run, skips past defenders and smashes the ball from the edge of the box past the diving goalkeeper. His low drive went into the bottom left corner. Absolutely phenomenal!
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Knut Kircher checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
The referee gives a yellow card to Dennis Diekmeier (Hamburger) for talking back. He must be careful for the remainder of the match.
The referee cannot ignore such behaviour. Karim Bellarabi (Braunschweig) sees a yellow card and needs to watch himself for the rest of the game.
Pierre-Michel Lasogga (Hamburger) leaps high to plant a header towards the right side of the goal. Daniel Davari is unable to keep the ball out and the score is 0:1.
Substitution. Marc Pfitzner (Braunschweig) replaces Omar Elabdellaoui.
The game has begun to heat up. Mirko Boland (Braunschweig) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Norman Theuerkauf (Braunschweig) was quite harsh and Knut Kircher didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Ken Reichel (Braunschweig) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Substitution. Norman Theuerkauf walks off the pitch and Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) comes on as a substitute.
GOAL! Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) was in the right place at the right time. He had a good position inside the box and scored from a rebound.
Substitution. Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) has come on for Rafael van der Vaart.
Tomas Rincon (Hamburger) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) is yellow-carded.
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) scores! He controls the ball from the free kick inside the 6-yard box and drills a superb strike into the bottom right corner.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Tomas Rincon as he is replaced by Hakan Calhanoglu (Hamburger).
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) unleashes a close-range volley low towards the middle of the goal, but his effort is thwarted by the keeper, and the score remains unchanged.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Ouasim Bouy (Hamburger) receives a yellow card!
Goal! Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home into the top left corner.
Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) is given a yellow card.
That's the end of the game for Ola John, who is replaced by Jacques Zoua (Hamburger).
Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) is penalised.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Deniz Dogan (Braunschweig) comes onto the pitch so that Havard Kallevik Nielsen can be given a rest.
Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) receives a great chance inside the box and slots the ball past the goalkeeper.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Referee Peter Sippel blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort. The ball is out of play. Dortmund win a corner kick.
Goal! Henrikh Mkhitaryan plays a pass to the feet of Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund), and he shoots into the roof of the net from inside the box. It's 1:0.

Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Kevin Trapp makes a great save to stop the effort going into the left side of the goal.
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang (Dortmund) collects a rebound and hits it precisely into the top of the net.
Bamba Anderson is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Marc-Oliver Kempf (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Peter Sippel has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt) is penalised for holding. Peter Sippel signals a set piece. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Dortmund!
Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) smoothly converts the penalty with a stunning effort which ends up inside the right post.

Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Kevin Trapp shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Substitution. Tobias Weis makes way for Stephan Schrock (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.
That will be all from Henrikh Mkhitaryan who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Milos Jojic (Dortmund).
Goal! Milos Jojic (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 4:0.
Marc-Oliver Kempf (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
Substitution. Bastian Oczipka (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on for Constant Djakpa.

Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Kevin Trapp. Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players.
Substitution. Julian Schieber (Dortmund) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Robert Lewandowski walks off.
Nuri Sahin (Dortmund) protests to the referee and receives a yellow card.
Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) argues with the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Stephan Schrock (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 1:0.
Timo Werner (VfB Stuttgart) quickly picks up the rebound and shoots towards the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save to deny him.
Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) makes some space for a shot from 30 metres and sends the ball goalwards. Unfortunately for him, it crashes only against the right post. It would have been a sublime goal.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Brilliant finish! Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Sejad Salihovic, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 2:0.
Yellow card. Rani Khedira (VfB Stuttgart) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Eugen Polanski (Hoffenheim) is given a yellow card.
The game is interrupted. Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
The manager makes a subsitution with Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) coming on for Martin Harnik.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card!
A substitution has been made. Kai Herdling goes off and Tobias Strobl (Hoffenheim) comes on.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) will replace Rani Khedira.
Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) collects a good pass and slams the ball from mid-range into the top right corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
The main referee  awards Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim) a yellow card.
The substitution is prepared. Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Sven Schipplock.
Sven Ulreich (VfB Stuttgart) is yellow-carded.
Kevin Volland (Hoffenheim) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Antonio Rudiger (VfB Stuttgart) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a bullet header from close range into the middle of the net. The score is 3:1.
Sending-off! Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) sees a second yellow card, followed by a red, and won't take part in the rest of the game.
Substitution. Timo Werner did his best and is replaced by Robin Yalcin (VfB Stuttgart).

Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) found himself in a promising position. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper was ready and made a decent save.
Substitution. Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim) has come on for Sejad Salihovic.

Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the bottom left corner is thwarted by Sven Ulreich. The ball goes out for a corner. Hoffenheim can continue in their attacking effort.
A penalty! Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) has taken the ball and will proceed with the goal-scoring opportunity.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) steps up to take the penalty and converts it with a shot into the roof of the net.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the roof of the net.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Ludovic Obraniak (Werder Bremen) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post. The ball goes to play from a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Assani Lukimya.
Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Marc-Andre ter Stegen.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Marc-Andre ter Stegen. Werder Bremen win a corner.
The end of the first half.
Tony Jantschke has picked up an injury and is replaced by Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach).
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen) collects the ball from the free kick and immediately sends his close-range effort just over the crossbar! The play will be restarted with a goal kick.

Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the right post. Raphael Wolf is alert and denies him with a nice save. The referee points to the corner flag and B. Monchengladbach will take a corner.
What an amazing save by Raphael Wolf! Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot low towards the middle of the target, but fails.
The substitution is prepared. Martin Kobylanski (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nils Petersen.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Filip Daems (B. Monchengladbach) is coming onto the pitch as Oscar Wendt cannot continue after picking up an injury.

What a goal-scoring opportunity! Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in. Corner kick. B. Monchengladbach will have an opportunity.
Today's match ends for Cedric Makiadi who will be replaced by Eljero Elia (Werder Bremen).
Aleksandar Ignjovski (Werder Bremen) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) is booked.

Alvaro Dominguez (B. Monchengladbach) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the middle of the goal. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Raphael Wolf with a fabulous save.
Ludovic Obraniak (Werder Bremen) scores a beautiful 20-metre free kick. He arrows the ball into the top right corner. The goalkeeper merely turned his head.
We are about to witness a substitution. Lukas Rupp (B. Monchengladbach) is replacing Branimir Hrgota.
Lukas Rupp (B. Monchengladbach) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Christian Schulz (Hannover) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Nicolai Muller (Mainz) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Loris Karius.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Here comes a substitution. Joo-Ho Park (Mainz) has had enough and is replaced by Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz).
Manuel Grafe blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Goal! Nicolai Muller tees up Yunus Malli (Mainz) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the left side of the goal. 1:0.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) picks up a yellow card.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Yunus Malli will be replaced by Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz).
It is time for a substitution. Edgar Prib (Hannover) is on for Leonardo Bittencourt.
The yellow card is received by Edgar Prib (Hannover).
Substitution. Totally exhausted Christian Schulz (Hannover) is leaving the pitch, and Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) will replace him.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Benedikt Saller (Mainz) left the pitch, and Niki Zimling (Mainz) is coming on to help his team.
The referee shows the yellow card to Niki Zimling (Mainz).

A brilliant individual effort! Shinji Okazaki (Mainz) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.
Maxim Choupo-Moting (Mainz) latches on to a precise pass inside the box and sends in a superb strike that finds its way into the bottom left corner.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Referee Christian Dingert blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Ron-Robert Zieler is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kaan Ayhan (Schalke) is coming onto the pitch as Roman Neustadter cannot continue after picking up an injury.
It's in the back of the net! Sead Kolasinac is the provider as he slips the ball to Jefferson Farfan (Schalke) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 1:0.
Goal! Atsuto Uchida rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Max Meyer (Schalke), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 2:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.

Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header narrowly over the crossbar! A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
Edgar Prib (Hannover) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Leonardo Bittencourt.
Here comes a substitution. Szabolcs Huszti is given a rest as he is replaced by Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover).
What a wasted opportunity by Max Meyer (Schalke)! He unleashed a powerful low shot from the centre of the box, but Ron-Robert Zieler makes a decent save to thwart him.
The referee shows the yellow card to Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover).
Substitution. Klaas-Jan Huntelaar makes his way off the pitch and Adam Szalai (Schalke) comes on as his replacement.

Great touch by Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save! The ball is out of play and Schalke manage to earn a corner.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Chinedu Obasi (Schalke) is leaving the pitch, and Leon Goretzka (Schalke) will replace him.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.

Mohammed Abdellaoue (VfB Stuttgart) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post. A short break for the players as the play will restart with a goal kick.

Mohammed Abdellaoue (VfB Stuttgart) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.
It's a goal! Tobias Werner plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Arkadiusz Milik (Augsburg). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:1.
CHANCE! Tobias Werner (Augsburg) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he sends his shot well wide of the left post. A goal kick will follow.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and curls the ball inside the left post in trademark fashion.
The end of the first half.
Referee Jochen Drees blows his whistle to start the second half.
Yellow card. Rani Khedira (VfB Stuttgart) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Vedad Ibisevic (VfB Stuttgart) cannot believe that he has been told to leave the field of play after the referee blows his whistle and sends him off!
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just over the crossbar. That will be a goal kick.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
It's in the back of the net! Moritz Leitner sprays a pass out to Konstantin Rausch (VfB Stuttgart), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:3.
Here comes a substitution. Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Alexandru Maxim.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. What a clinical finish!
Arkadiusz Milik comes off the pitch to be replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Good clearance! Halil Altintop (Augsburg) receives a brilliant short pass and finds himself in a good position inside the box, but he's been robbed of the ball by one of the defending players.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Robin Yalcin (VfB Stuttgart) comes onto the pitch for Timo Werner.
That will be all from Andre Hahn who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Alexander Esswein (Augsburg).
Robin Yalcin (VfB Stuttgart) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jeong-Ho Hong (Augsburg) coming on for Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker.
Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) slams the ball goalwards from 25 metres out, but his decent effort flies a whisker wide of the right post. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
Today's match ends for Konstantin Rausch who will be replaced by Arthur Boka (VfB Stuttgart).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just wide of the left post. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
Deniz Aytekin blows the whistle. Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) committed a foul when he hit the opponent's legs instead of the ball. A penalty for a foul is awarded to Hertha Berlin.
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) fails to score from the penalty spot. His effort towards the right post lacks any pace and that allows the goalkeeper to make a stunning save.
The ball from the corner slips through the box to Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin) and he fires it into the bottom left corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds the head of Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin), who rises and produces an amazing header into the bottom left corner.
Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the left post. That will be a goal kick.
Goal - 0:3! Johannes van den Bergh laid the ball off to Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The end of the first half.
Substitution. Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) on for Ouasim Bouy.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) goes on a great solo and run skips past two defenders, but he fails to beat Rene Adler.
Thomas Kraft pulls off a fantastic save! Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the right post, but the effort is kept out.
A neat pass is well received by Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Substitution. Hakan Calhanoglu did his best and is replaced by Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger).
The game has come to an end for Per Skjelbred. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Peter Niemeyer (Hertha Berlin).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Heiko Westermann (Hamburger) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Deniz Aytekin ignores the protests.
Ronny (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Tolga Cigerci.
Substitution. Adrian Ramos is replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Sebastian Jung sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Johannes Flum (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to it and finishes with a quick low shot into the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:0.

Sebastian Jung (Eintracht Frankfurt) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one! The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Eintracht Frankfurt will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The substitution has been made. Alexander Madlung (Eintracht Frankfurt) has replaced Pirmin Schwegler.

What a chance that is! Karim Bellarabi (Braunschweig) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the left post. The play will restart with a goal kick.

Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) was in a good shooting position just outside the box and unleashed a first-time shot towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper made a decent save to thwart his effort. Eintracht Frankfurt get a corner.
Alexander Meier (Eintracht Frankfurt) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release a low effort which ends up in the bottom right corner.

It's in the back of the net! Sebastian Jung slips the ball through to Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt), and he darts into the box to unleash a strong shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 3:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Johannes Flum as he is replaced by Tranquillo Barnetta (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Omar Elabdellaoui did his best and is replaced by Domi Kumbela (Braunschweig).

Daniel Davari makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded by Vaclav Kadlec (Eintracht Frankfurt) after a cross from the side. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Eintracht Frankfurt.

Benjamin Kessel (Braunschweig) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a cross from the set piece. He jumps high but his towering header lacks a little bit of accuracy and crashes against the crossbar.
Here comes a substitution. Jan Hochscheidt (Braunschweig) has had enough and is replaced by Mirko Boland (Braunschweig).
It's like he was asking for a caution. Sebastian Jung (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Norman Theuerkauf (Braunschweig).
Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets a yellow card.
Substitution. Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) in, Vaclav Kadlec out.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marcel Correia (Braunschweig) is coming onto the pitch as Kevin Kratz cannot continue after picking up an injury.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Sebastian Rudy (Hoffenheim) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Mensur Mujdza (Freiburg) got a yellow card. A free kick to Hoffenheim.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Kai Herdling (Hoffenheim) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick low shot towards the middle of the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows Oliver Baumann to make a comfortable save.
Goal! Admir Mehmedi displays great vision and sends a pass to Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 1:0.
This is a yellow card! Vladimir Darida (Freiburg) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Kai Herdling (Hoffenheim) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Substitution. Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) in, Sebastian Rudy out.
The game has come to an end for Sejad Salihovic. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Sven Schipplock (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. David Abraham makes his way off the pitch and Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
That will be all from Vladimir Darida who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Mike Hanke (Freiburg).
Goal! Sven Schipplock tees up Anthony Modeste (Hoffenheim) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the left side of the goal. 1:1.
Matthias Ginter (Freiburg) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Referee Tobias Welz blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

OFF THE BAR! Hiroshi Kiyotake (Nurnberg) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball crashes against the crossbar. The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.
Timothy Chandler is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Martin Angha (Nurnberg).
Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper.
Goal! David Alaba puts a cross into the box and finds Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the right post. He makes it 0:1.
Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg) comes onto the pitch after Daniel Ginczek signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) executes the set piece from the edge of the box in a brilliant manner! His terrific effort looks goal bound, but it only hit the left post!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) blows an opportunity from close range as he heads a rebound onto to the crossbar!

Tomas Pekhart (Nurnberg) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
What was Adam Hlousek (Nurnberg) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Goal - 0:2! Mario Mandzukic laid the ball off to Philipp Lahm (Bayern Munich), who shot from close range into the top of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The foul by Javier Pinola (Nurnberg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Welz.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) collects a pin-point pass inside the box and tries a snap shot in the vicinity of the left post, but the goalkeeper dives perfectly to deny him. The ball bounces off his gloves and brushes the post. That was a fantastic reflex save. Bayern Munich earn a corner.
Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Here comes a substitution. Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for Thomas Muller.
A substitution has been made. Adam Hlousek is replaced by Timo Gebhart (Nurnberg).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) will replace Arjen Robben.
Substitution. Mario Mandzukic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich).
Tobias Welz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Gunter Perl checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Gunter Perl had an easy-decision to make.
Manuel Friedrich (Dortmund) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.

Marcel Schmelzer produces a sweet pass and picks out Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 0:0!

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) scores with a great individual effort! He makes a good run, skips past defenders and fires the ball from the edge of the box past the diving goalkeeper. His low drive went into the bottom left corner. Absolutely phenomenal!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Gunter Perl blows his whistle to start the second half.
Manuel Friedrich (Dortmund) gets on the end of the corner kick deep inside the box and beats the keeper with a precise close-range shot into the bottom right corner.
CHANCE! Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar. It will be a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Franco Di Santo.
The substitution has been made. Martin Kobylanski (Werder Bremen) has replaced Eljero Elia.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar. A goal kick will follow.
Goal - 0:2! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Dortmund) receives a precise pass inside the box from Marco Reus and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.

Nils Petersen (Werder Bremen) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Roman Weidenfeller guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kevin Grosskreutz (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Marco Reus can be given a rest.
Substitution. Sven Bender leaves the pitch and is replaced by Sebastian Kehl (Dortmund).
Sokratis (Dortmund) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Martin Kobylanski (Werder Bremen) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Ludovic Obraniak (Werder Bremen) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the bottom left corner, but Roman Weidenfeller easily deals with the threat.
Substitution. Jonas Hofmann (Dortmund) has come on for Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.
Here comes a substitution. Aaron Hunt (Werder Bremen) has had enough and is replaced by Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen).

Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) accepted an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashed a decent strike towards the top right corner of the goal. The goalkeeper, however, was alert and thwarted the effort.

An amazing individual effort from Robert Lewandowski (Dortmund) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom left corner and makes it 0:5. Raphael Wolf was helpless.
Goal! Levent Aycicek (Werder Bremen) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Junior Diaz (Mainz) is coming onto the pitch as Christoph Moritz cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Julian Koch (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.

Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) takes a nice first touch to control a cross and fires in from the penalty spot, but his effort zooms just past the left post. The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.

Zdenek Pospech (Mainz) aims a low effort to the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save. Zdenek Pospech (Mainz) fails to keep his cool and squanders a golden chance to score from inside the penalty area after firing the ball over the crossbar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case. Wolfsburg are awarded a penalty kick!
Ricardo Rodriguez (Wolfsburg) scores from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Substitution. Ivan Perisic makes his way off the pitch and Ivica Olic (Wolfsburg) comes on as his replacement.
Ivica Olic passes to Bas Dost (Wolfsburg), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 2:0.
Substitution. Julian Koch walks off the pitch and Shawn Parker (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ja-Cheol Koo trots off the pitch and is replaced by Nicolai Muller (Mainz).
What was Naldo (Wolfsburg) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) shows good awareness to meet the corner and heads home.
Substitution. Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) replaces Bas Dost.
The manager makes a subsitution with Junior Malanda (Wolfsburg) coming on for Christian Trasch.
Loris Karius hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Marcel Schafer (Wolfsburg) shoots from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save.
The match has just finished.
Florian Meyer checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
The yellow card is received by Philipp Wollscheid (Bayer Leverkusen).
Florian Meyer shows a yellow card to Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) for a tough tackle.
Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Florian Meyer starts the second half.

Unbelievable miss! Juan Arango (B. Monchengladbach) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar! The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Emre Can (Bayer Leverkusen) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires from the edge of the box to the middle of the goal, but Marc-Andre ter Stegen is equal to it.
Goal - 0:1! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the top right corner. Sidney Sam provided an assist for the goal.
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann will be replaced by Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) in, Sidney Sam out.
Golden chance! Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Giulio Donati (Bayer Leverkusen) is the one who receives a yellow card.

Juan Arango (B. Monchengladbach) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Bernd Leno made a crucial save!
The game has come to an end for Heung-Min Son. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jens Hegeler (Bayer Leverkusen).
Substitution. Granit Xhaka makes his way off the pitch and Peniel Kokou Mlapa (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as his replacement.
Substitution. Juan Arango is replaced by Amin Younes (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Stefan Kiessling walks off the pitch and Philipp Wollscheid (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) picks up a cross inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the right side of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Kevin Trapp, who pulls off a stunning save!
Xherdan Shaqiri (Bayern Munich) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only rattles the right post.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post. It's a goal kick.
Goal - 1:0! Mario Mandzukic laid the ball off to Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.

Constant Djakpa (Eintracht Frankfurt) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and powers the ball into the bottom left corner of the target, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Great touch by Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) as he receives a precise pass deep in the box. He rips a snap shot and the ball bounces off the goalkeeper's gloves and hits the post. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Bayern Munich.

Kevin Trapp pulls off a great save to deny Rafinha (Bayern Munich) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal. The ball is out of play and Bayern Munich manage to earn a corner.

Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) dribbles deep into the box and releases a strike towards the middle of the goal, but Kevin Trapp makes a sensational reflex save and punches the ball onto the post. Superb goalkeeping!

Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) blows a big chance from close range. World class save by the goalkeeper. The ball goes behind for a corner. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The manager has decided to substitute Tranquillo Barnetta (Eintracht Frankfurt) and he has been replaced by Stefan Aigner (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The substitution has been made. Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) has replaced Xherdan Shaqiri.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Tobias Weis (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch so that Pirmin Schwegler can be given a rest.
What a goal-scoring opportunity! Joselu (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in.

Goal! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) latches on to a superb pass inside the box, finds himself in a promising position and fires a shot in off the crossbar. The goalkeeper was helpless to keep out his effort.
Franck Ribery takes the corner and Dante (Bayern Munich) manages to jump the highest in the box and plants a precise header in off the right post. The score is 4:0.
Substitution. David Alaba is replaced by Diego Contento (Bayern Munich).
Here comes a substitution. Mario Gtze (Bayern Munich) has had enough and is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich).
Felix Wiedwald (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch because Kevin Trapp simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) zig-zags his way into the box and fails to direct a shot inside the left post. The goalkeeper pulls off a miraculous stop. Bayern Munich will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) misses an absolute sitter after connecting with a cross inside the penalty box. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.
Mario Mandzukic (Bayern Munich) dribbles into the box and fires the ball inside the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance. Sensational solo goal.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Michael Weiner checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Johannes van den Bergh (Hertha Berlin) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.

Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Ronny. His header bounced off the ground and went inside the left post behind the goalkeeper. It's 1:0.

Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Raphael Schafer guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Markus Feulner (Nurnberg) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Thomas Kraft. 1:1.
Substitution. Johannes van den Bergh did his best and is replaced by Peter Pekarik (Hertha Berlin).
Mike Frantz (Nurnberg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Excellent touch by Sami Allagui (Hertha Berlin)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and produces a low drive towards the right post. The goalkeeper pulls off a beautiful save to deny him.
Adrian Ramos (Hertha Berlin) sends in a shot from a promising distance after a precise pass. His effort goes inches over the crossbar. A goal kick will follow.
Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin) fires the ball towards the left side of the goal from close-range, but his shot is blocked by one of the defenders.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Sebastian Langkamp (Hertha Berlin) wastes a huge opportunity after receiving a fine cross from the free kick, but his close-range shot goes well over the crossbar. The ball goes to play from a goal kick.
Ronny (Hertha Berlin) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Daniel Ginczek (Nurnberg) misses a great chance to score after his effort hits the left post!
Goal! Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:2.
Markus Feulner (Nurnberg) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
The substitution is prepared. Hany Mukhtar (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nico Schulz.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Hajime Hosogai will be replaced by Sandro Wagner (Hertha Berlin).
Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The substitution has been made. Timo Gebhart (Nurnberg) has replaced Hiroshi Kiyotake.
The yellow card goes to Timo Gebhart (Nurnberg).
Marcel N'Djeng (Hertha Berlin) tackles a bit over-zealously and Michael Weiner blows for a foul. No point in arguing there. Nurnberg will take a penalty kick.
Josip Drmic (Nurnberg) takes the penalty and perfectly sends the ball inside the left post.
Michael Weiner is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Bastian Dankert checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.

Leonardo Bittencourt (Hannover) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.

Mame Diouf (Hannover) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Marc-Andre ter Stegen is alert and denies him with a nice save. The ball goes out of play. Hannover are awarded a corner kick.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

It's a goal! Artjoms Rudnevs (Hannover) makes it 0:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Szabolcs Huszti and planted his close-range header into the top right corner. Marc-Andre ter Stegen was helpless.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) gets a shot from inside the penalty area and it flies just wide of the left post. A goal kick will follow.
Juan Arango goes off the pitch and Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.

What a wasted opportunity by Raffael (B. Monchengladbach)! He creates himself some space inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the top of the net, but Ron-Robert Zieler makes an astonishing save to thwart him. The ball is out of play. B. Monchengladbach will have a chance to score from a corner.
The foul by Julian Korb (B. Monchengladbach) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.
That's the end of the game for Patrick Herrmann, who is replaced by Amin Younes (B. Monchengladbach).
Granit Xhaka (B. Monchengladbach) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
The manager has decided to substitute Granit Xhaka (B. Moenchengladbach) and he has been replaced by Peniel Mlapa (B. Moenchengladbach).

Goal! Szabolcs Huszti clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Mame Diouf (Hannover), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the bottom right corner. Marc-Andre ter Stegen had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.

A perfect lofted pass from Amin Younes finds Peniel Kokou Mlapa (B. Monchengladbach), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Ron-Robert Zieler had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Mame Diouf (Hannover) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
The whistle blows and Szabolcs Huszti (Hannover) is booked for an infringement.
Substitution. Szabolcs Huszti makes way for Leon Andreasen (Hannover).
The manager makes a subsitution with Jan Schlaudraff (Hannover) coming on for Artjoms Rudnevs.
Mame Diouf (Hannover) receives a great chance inside the box and drills a shot into the bottom left corner.
Substitution. Sebastien Pocognoli (Hannover) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Leonardo Bittencourt walks off.
Bastian Dankert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Christian Dingert checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
It's an own goal! An unlucky moment for Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg), who heads the corner kick behind his keeper's back with a poor header. The score is 0:1.
Felix Kroos (Werder Bremen) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort came back off the right post!
Tobias Werner (Augsburg) tries his luck from a direct free kick and the ball goes inside the right post. The goalkeeper couldnt do anything with such a great shot.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.

What a great chance for Andre Hahn (Augsburg). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header towards the foot of the left post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. Augsburg get a corner.
Santiago Garcia (Werder Bremen) has weakened his team by being sent-off early, following two yellow cards and the inevitable red.
Caution goes to Franco Di Santo (Werder Bremen).
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Nils Petersen will be replaced by Lukas Schmitz (Werder Bremen).
Christian Dingert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) will replace Felix Kroos.
Goal! Andre Hahn sends a precise cross into the box, Halil Altintop (Augsburg) latches on to it and puts the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:1.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) has a great chance inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Substitution. Franco Di Santo is replaced by Martin Kobylanski (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Arkadiusz Milik will be replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
It's a yellow card for Luca Caldirola (Werder Bremen).
The referee signals a substitution. Alexander Esswein (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Tobias Werner.
That will be all from Halil Altintop who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Dominik Kohr (Augsburg).
The whistle blows and Dominik Kohr (Augsburg) is booked for an infringement.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Referee Felix Zwayer blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Goal! Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the top left corner. 0:1.

Goal! Simon Rolfes displays great vision and sends a pass to Stefan Kiessling (Bayer Leverkusen), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top right corner. The score is 1:1.
OFF THE BAR! Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.
Heung-Min Son (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game has come to an end for Stefan Reinartz. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Sidney Sam (Bayer Leverkusen).
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Emir Spahic (Bayer Leverkusen) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge. A free kick has been awarded to Stuttgart.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Martin Harnik (VfB Stuttgart) is leaving the pitch, and Alexandru Maxim (VfB Stuttgart) will replace him.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) for Heung-Min Son.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Timo Werner walks off the pitch to be replaced by Ibrahima Traore (VfB Stuttgart).
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Rani Khedira (VfB Stuttgart).
Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) strikes with a perfect low header inside the left post after a brilliant cross! He found himself unmarked and nodded the ball past the goalkeeper. Brilliant finish!
Moritz Leitner (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make.

Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort flies narrowly over the bar. The ball ends behind the line. A goal kick is following.
Substitution. Cacau (VfB Stuttgart) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Rani Khedira walks off.
Substitution. Philipp Wollscheid (Bayer Leverkusen) on for Stefan Kiessling.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Eren Derdiyok (Bayer Leverkusen) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
That's it for today, Felix Zwayer has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Goal! Kevin Volland plays a pass to the feet of Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim), and he shoots into the bottom right corner from inside the box. It's 1:0.
Jacques Zoua (Hamburger) wins the ball from the corner kick and strikes. The effort lacks accuracy and goes miles wide of the left post.
Milan Badelj (Hamburger) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

A perfect lofted pass from Sejad Salihovic finds Niklas Sule (Hoffenheim), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the top right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Jaroslav Drobny had no chance of stopping that. 2:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Gunter Perl has ended it.
The second half has just started.

Sejad Salihovic (Hoffenheim) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Jaroslav Drobny made an astonishing save!
Here comes a substitution. Tired Ola John (Hamburger) left the pitch, and Ivo Ilicevic (Hamburger) is coming on to help his team.
Goal! Roberto Firmino puts the ball on a plate for Andreas Beck (Hoffenheim), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 3:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Tolgay Arslan (Hamburger) is coming onto the pitch as Ouasim Bouy cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Jiloan Hamad (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Sejad Salihovic.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tarik Elyounoussi (Hoffenheim) comes onto the pitch for Kai Herdling.
Roberto Firmino (Hoffenheim) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and shoots towards goal, but it goes well wide of the right post.
Substitution. Jannik Vestergaard (Hoffenheim) in, Sebastian Rudy out.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

What a goal! Joo-Ho Park (Mainz) receives an accurate pass and tries his luck with a long-range shot. He unleashes a superb strike that goes into the roof of the net and behind the goalkeeper. The keeper just wasn't fast enough.
Julian Schuster (Freiburg) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
The yellow card is received by Nikolce Noveski (Mainz).
Close! Jonathan Schmid (Freiburg) stands over the resulting free kick from around 25 metres out and his shot goes just over the crossbar.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Robert Hartmann starts the second half.
Julian Schuster comes off the pitch to be replaced by Francis Coquelin (Freiburg).
Here comes a substitution. Tired Vaclav Pilar (Freiburg) left the pitch, and Felix Klaus (Freiburg) is coming on to help his team.
The substitution is prepared. Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Yunus Malli.
Substitution. Mike Hanke (Freiburg) has come on for Gelson Fernandes.

This shall not pass! Admir Mehmedi (Freiburg) lines up a shot from the edge of the box and goes for goal, but the effort is well blocked by a defender. The ball goes out of play. Freiburg are awarded a corner kick.
It is time for a substitution. Julian Koch (Mainz) is on for Christoph Moritz.

Junior Diaz (Mainz) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) picks up a yellow card.

Ja-Cheol Koo (Mainz) broke through the defence and unleashed a powerful effort from the edge of the 18-yard box which went into the top left corner, leaving the goalkeeper rooted to the spot! Brilliant piece of art!
It's time for a substitution. Niko Bungert (Mainz) comes on in place of Junior Diaz.
Mensur Mujdza (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Yellow card. Naldo (Wolfsburg) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.

Diego Benaglio pulls off a great save to deny Kevin-Prince Boateng (Schalke), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner. Schalke win a corner.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Felipe Santana (Schalke) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header straight into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:0.

Patrick Ochs (Wolfsburg) hammers the ball goalwards from about 20 metres. The shot is directed to the top right corner but is thwarted by a save from Ralf Fahrmann. The ball goes out for a corner. Wolfsburg can continue in their attacking effort.
Wolfgang Stark shows a yellow card to Kevin De Bruyne (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.

Luiz Gustavo (Wolfsburg) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Patrick Ochs (Wolfsburg) uses the wrong choice of words while trying to explain something to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Wolfgang Stark blows his whistle to start the second half.
Daniel Caligiuri (Wolfsburg) probably spoke out of turn to the referee and is sent off for dissent.
Klaas-Jan Huntelaar (Schalke) collects a pass and has an effort from 13 metres out, but it flies just wide of the right post. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.
A yellow card for a tackle by Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke (Schalke). Wolfgang Stark doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Bas Dost (Wolfsburg) on for Ivica Olic.
Substitution. Chinedu Obasi Ogbuke walks off the pitch and Leon Goretzka (Schalke) comes on as a substitute.
Ivan Perisic (Wolfsburg) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom left corner, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Goal! The rebound fell to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:1.

Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Peter Gagelmann had an easy-decision to make.

Max Kruse (B. Monchengladbach) dribbles deep into the box and releases a strike towards the left side of the goal, but Manuel Neuer makes a sensational reflex save and punches the ball onto the post. Superb goalkeeping!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Peter Gagelmann blows his whistle to start the second half.
Mario Gotze (Bayern Munich) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and drills a shot to the middle of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from Marc-Andre ter Stegen.

Granit Xhaka (B. Moenchengladbach) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. We are about to witness a penalty kick. Thomas Mller (Bayern Munich) immediately took the ball and won't let anyone else execute it.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) coolly converts the penalty. His precise shot goes inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort rattles the left post! What a shot that was!
We are about to witness a subsitution. Branimir Hrgota (B. Monchengladbach) for Patrick Herrmann.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Toni Kroos (Bayern Munich) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) will replace Xherdan Shaqiri.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Mario Gtze (Bayern Munich) left the pitch, and Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) is coming on to help his team.

What a chance that is! David Alaba (Bayern Munich) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the left post! A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
Substitution. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Bayern Munich) replaces Toni Kroos.

Claudio Pizarro (Bayern Munich) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Marc-Andre ter Stegen, who pulls off a decent save!
